commit_message:
Add TLS enabled support for pools

Bump openstacksdk to 0.53.0, it provides the tls_enabled flag for
Octavia pools.

Story 2008368
Task 41277

Change-Id: I41559e3f2d13e5adbb850f28f058b72404e28124

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 15:40:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)
(cherry picked from commit bf5a4a9849d7cb067d36ca57fd8538faed016715)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)
(cherry picked from commit bf5a4a9849d7cb067d36ca57fd8538faed016715)

commit_message:
Add ciphers options for listeners and pools

Added an option to specify the TLS ciphers used by listeners
and pools. It is specifed through a string in OpenSSL syntax.

Change-Id: Icead9106b06ae7610301a121e51dc5fe1a0e4056
Co-authored-by: Steven Glasford <stevenglasford@gmail.com>
Story: 2006627
Task: 37193

commit_message:
Add missing ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent service into tripleo_containers.yaml.j2.

When using DVR the Compute roles make use of the services
ComputeNeutronOvsAgent, ComputeNeutronL3Agent, ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent
and ComputeNeutronCorePlugin. However, the ComputeNeutronMetadataAgent was
missing from the tripleo_containers.yaml.j2 which causes issues at the time
of retrieving the images from the Undercloud registry.

Related-Bug: #1898256
Change-Id: I52204ec1bcb3a43e5d8e8503871a27b8bfb88e7b
(cherry picked from commit d2a5d9856d109ce39f598dc64aeb41e9e4f3304b)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25402, 'name': 'Francesco Pantano', 'email': 'fpantano@redhat.com', 'username': 'fmount'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2021-03-11 11:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-11 14:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 10:54:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix start order for swift_proxy and swift_proxy_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started too soon, when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642
'}, {'created': '2021-03-11 11:37:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642
'}]
commit_message:
Fix start order for {swift_proxy,glance_api}_tls_proxy

In stack updates adding TLS to Swift would not work because
swift_proxy_tls_proxy is started when the pre-existing
swift_proxy container is still up and listening on the TCP port
which should instead be used by swift_proxy_tls_proxy

This change ensures swift_proxy_tls_proxy and glance_api_tls_proxy
containers are started after the actual swift_proxy and glance_api
containers are started.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I980dfc54b799c6b1d648489a727a590dd26fa502
Closes-Bug: 1918642

commit_message:
Activate virtual environment

Enable virtualenv after installation. Without it, python packages from
system location will be used. So if bindep is not installed in system
packages the failure will be as

~/tripleo-validations/scripts/..//scripts/bindep-install: line 37: bindep: command not found

This patch activates virtualenv after creation on previous step in
accordance rather than before pytest.

Change-Id: I3725bf64bead30b02f10eb9a68d220c4e422b531

commit_message:
Fix logic to honor HorizonDebug

Debug always has one of true/false and is always set. We should check
whether HorizonDebug is set instead of whether Debug is set.

Also, this change fixes the current logic to make sure that
HorizonDebug: false is honored even when Debug: true is set.

Closes-Bug: #1908362
Change-Id: I514b5a3d4133d3561376ea06a803d019acaa0f0b
(cherry picked from commit f89140402ef211f92309646c2d935d5b9e593f99)
(cheery picked from commit bb7d59c65a1c0feacfa4b05904dfe3f4ca287cdf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-05 21:36:28.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-manager-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-compute-common-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c
Change-Id: Ia4a29bdd2cd8e894bcc7c0078cf0f0ab0f97de0a
Closes-bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 9d82364de8d6d1fba083993e085fb8cafcc08268)
(cherry picked from commit a2a6ddab59e60ba977ac85b9881530ae3b5bb0c7)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-manager-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-compute-common-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c
Change-Id: Ia4a29bdd2cd8e894bcc7c0078cf0f0ab0f97de0a
Closes-bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 9d82364de8d6d1fba083993e085fb8cafcc08268)
(cherry picked from commit a2a6ddab59e60ba977ac85b9881530ae3b5bb0c7)

Stable jobs: run the tests on victoria, remove stein

Update the list of tested stable branches (excluding stein which is EM).
The nodesets for the stable branches are now pinned because
their testing environment are well defined and won't change.

Also, remove the -py3 suffix: those jobs are all -py3 based
(the suffix was mostly requires in the transitional time
between py2 and py3).

Change-Id: I48f8574960df51fc47f80fa17091fd13ec71aa99

commit_message:
Add replication_probe_interval for ovsdbs

Add posibilities to configure replication_probe_interval for ovsdb-server.
It configure probe interval for connection for ovsdb-server when it is
in backup mode and connects to the active ovsdb-server for replication

Change-Id: I80c2377ea0223f0003e8e0982f1bc3c1b32b6d06

commit_message:
Stop including nova::metadata on computes

I5da1e67684f8317eec8c499c3534977e00a63098 include nova::metadata on computes
however this includes nova::db which we must not do on computes.
Push the fix up to puppet-nova and nova.

Depends-On: If6a26527a737a7184ebddd5b4bc346d64827e9e3
Depends-On: I47b95ad46e2d4e5b1f370a2f840826e87da2d703
Change-Id: I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c
Related-bug: #1871482
Related-bug: #1903908
Related-bug: #1832537
(cherry picked from commit 287b1b6ce77fe143d781ccd1b900c3bdbe6ada87)
(cherry picked from commit 3e92158b57d1bd1bdac54b52660df8ae1da06742)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary zuul layout overrides use templates instead

This removes unnecessary zuul layout overrides. The containers
multinode and standalone/scenarios are already included via the
wired-up templates. Keeps only the undercloud-minion which is not
in the tripleo-multinode-container-minimal-pipeline [1] but updates
the consumer job vars. Part of tripleo-ci optimisation at [2].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/src/commit/67a58a43788dfff284ec55eff6f4e65c0116160b/zuul.d/multinode-jobs.yaml#L71-L85
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I7c4ba85cbc1525079a94cb76aa9576b24f1d0fbb

commit_message:
[Pure] Add missing FC host personality support

Previously this was only set for iSCSI hosts and FC hosts were missed.
Fix to allow feature to cover Fibre Channel attached hosts as well.

Change-Id: Ie097d8938aa9cac6b28efef37f805338be4b0336

subject: Depend on corresponding server in WaitCondition
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-14 14:28:10.000000000', 'message': 'Depend on corresponding server in WaitCondition

most of the templates used in scenario tests already do this
to exclude unpredictable (especially in virtualized cloud CI environments)
server boot from the wait condition timeout, however 3 templates
(used in 3 tests) are missing this at the moment.

This patch adds an explicit depends_on on the server that the
WaitCondition is waiting for in all scanario templates that use
WaitConditions.

Change-Id: I43d5b3862970db5217651b570525f696910bf320
'}]
commit_message:
Depend on corresponding server in WaitCondition

most of the templates used in scenario tests already do this
to exclude unpredictable (especially in virtualized cloud CI environments)
server boot from the wait condition timeout, however 3 templates
(used in 3 tests) are missing this at the moment.

This patch adds an explicit depends_on on the server that the
WaitCondition is waiting for in all scanario templates that use
WaitConditions.

Change-Id: I43d5b3862970db5217651b570525f696910bf320

commit_message:
Add example of logging setting for Manila

This change demonstrates how we can define logging setting specific to
manila-ui, so that operators can easily understand how to customize
logging level and so on.

Change-Id: Ia8505d988ed75e0358452b5b3c2889b364680f22

commit_message:
Release final python-tackerclient for Wallaby

This proposed a release for python-tackerclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, March 11.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.5.0..4e6dc4c
4e6dc4c CLI for Individual VNF LCM Operation Occurrence
6b29bb7 Support CLI for Getting List of VNF LCM Operation Occurrences
1299e15 Support of Retry VNF command in openstackclient
cfe1411 Support CLI of Change External VNF Connectivity
5816753 Support of Fail VNF command in openstackclient
e7a0c96 Fix error message for nonexistent vnf package
68df829 Dropping explicit unicode literal
17f4bca Fix old links in installation guide
69d9668 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I84ada4201cd05b2d65c8c28d5cb7208f7700e038

commit_message:
Always reset CONF when starting the wsgi app

This ensures that options loaded during any prior run of the
application are dropped before being added again during init_application.

Change-Id: I968cbe6091856c3090840511e8006af518b99f3a

subject: Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-03-10 21:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-03-11 15:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 21:19:56.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times

It can happen that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE gets interpreted as a boolean
and not as a string. This has the consequence that python
when calling subprocess.run() will call os.fsencode() on the
boolean variable and we can get the following error:

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/
usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 423, in run\n    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 729, in __init__\n    restore_signals, start_new_session
)\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 1275, in _execute_child\n    env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/os.py\", line 800, in fsencode\n    filename = fspath(f
ilename)  # Does type-checking of `filename`.\nTypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not bool\n",
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "command": "/var/lib/container-config-scripts/pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh cinder_volume openstack-cinder-volume openstack-cinder-volume Started",
            "environment": {
                "TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE": true
            },

Let's force it to be a string so we can never hit this.

Tested on the provided reproducer.

Change-Id: Ia4caa36a6edd865b3e1dcdf9254c7f183b64faaf
Closes-Bug: #1918111
(cherry picked from commit bdd2cfe2dfab6b7cd203211ba2adfb71a0aee27d)
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times

It can happen that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE gets interpreted as a boolean
and not as a string. This has the consequence that python
when calling subprocess.run() will call os.fsencode() on the
boolean variable and we can get the following error:

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/
usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 423, in run\n    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 729, in __init__\n    restore_signals, start_new_session
)\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 1275, in _execute_child\n    env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/os.py\", line 800, in fsencode\n    filename = fspath(f
ilename)  # Does type-checking of `filename`.\nTypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not bool\n",
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "command": "/var/lib/container-config-scripts/pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh cinder_volume openstack-cinder-volume openstack-cinder-volume Started",
            "environment": {
                "TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE": true
            },

Let's force it to be a string so we can never hit this.

Tested on the provided reproducer.

Change-Id: Ia4caa36a6edd865b3e1dcdf9254c7f183b64faaf
Closes-Bug: #1918111
(cherry picked from commit bdd2cfe2dfab6b7cd203211ba2adfb71a0aee27d)

subject: Avoid adding implicit dep with external rsrc
messages:
[{'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-26 16:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-26 18:38:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you elaborate on what actually happened?

I don't agree with the premise that resources with external IDs appearing in their correct position in the dependency graph is a Bad Thing. Part of the goal of external IDs is that users can 'adopt' the resource by removing them later, at which point we *want* them at the right place in the dependency graph.

Obviously we need to address the failures though."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-27 10:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-27 19:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This makes sense, although the issue would also be solved by the fix for bug 1708209 (If7e0e8fd46b1b06a29cdd89743635ed32a9392e7) as soon as it merges - which may actually be today as it has finally been reviewed and approved.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-28 07:31:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

IMO, we still need this change because we allow setting properties for external_id. So think about case when we provide property `network` for an external subnet resource (keep in mind that we actually won't use any property in any way for external rsrc), and create another router resource with same network information. Router will check network property in subnet and add dep cross router and subnet."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-10 03:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-10 03:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1767149 to story/1767149'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-10 17:09:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> So think about case when we provide property `network` for an external subnet resource (keep in mind that we actually won't use any property in any way for external rsrc), and create another router resource with same network information. Router will check network property in subnet and add dep cross router and subnet.

That's correct though. Those are the actual dependencies."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-05 07:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

bump'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-05 07:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We should not allow trying to fetch properties for external resource and wait for errors because it will error for sure. So why not skip it earlier. Also, we need to prevent external resource to count dependancy to other resources in stack.py'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-02-03 05:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

bump'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-01-22 04:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}]

commit_message:
Avoid adding implicit dep with external rsrc

Avoid adding implicit dependencies with external resources.
Make sure we not try to add implicit dependency with external resource.
Since dependencies are for make sure resources binded with the
right order, it should not link to an implicit way with external
resource.

Story: #1767149
Task: #17361

Change-Id: Ia83bd6df3e759167ae47b092ab247efe7fd0b3d4

'}, {'created': '2021-03-09 14:50:59.000000000', 'message': "Create user locally

This change to the tripleo_create_admin role adds
local:true to the create user task. This has a side
effect of idempotency to close the related bug since
it checks /etc/passwd before attempting to add the
account and so the command does not get run more than
once. This task's goal is to enable local ssh on the
system so that ansible can use the account.

Change-Id: I6dfa3d9b799ea9298cb1a59054ebd8d2e704a2ff
Closes-Bug: #1918188
"}, {'created': '2021-03-09 14:52:38.000000000', 'message': "Create user locally

This change to the tripleo_create_admin role adds
local:true to the create user task. This has a side
effect of idempotency to close the related bug since
it checks /etc/passwd before attempting to add the
account and so the command does not get run more than
once. This task's goal is to enable local ssh on the
system so that ansible can use the account.

Change-Id: I6dfa3d9b799ea9298cb1a59054ebd8d2e704a2ff
Closes-Bug: #1918188
"}, {'created': '2021-03-10 04:44:32.000000000', 'message': 'Create ceph-admin user with its own playbook

Calling the cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml playbook from within
the tripleo_run_cephadm role can result in the the bug this
patch closes. Instead, create this user with a different
playbook which includes the same roles.

This change also moves a list of tasks from directly within
the cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml playbook into a separate tasks
file (ssh_keys.yml) within the tripleo_create_admin role so
that those tasks can be more easily re-used.

commit_message:
Create ceph-admin user with its own playbook

Calling the cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml playbook from within
the tripleo_run_cephadm role can result in the the bug this
patch closes. Instead, create this user with a different
playbook which includes the tripleo_create_admin.

Change-Id: I6dfa3d9b799ea9298cb1a59054ebd8d2e704a2ff
Closes-Bug: #1918188

(4 comments)

I believe there's still a problem with the sizing of the batches, which also indicates that we need a unit test that actually checks that.

commit_message:
Add batch_delete policy in resource group

Add batch_delete policy in resource group. Allow us to request
batch delete when delete a resource group. With option
`max_batch_size` and `pause_time`, we can make sure there're
enough pause time between batches.
Story: #1715398
Task: #15999

Change-Id: I16d3cf8ff19a9af60b06ecb1d009cb64aec1af58

commit_message:
Reuse the docs deps to benefit from constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building releasenotes,
doc which may not be supported by stable and lower branches,
so should be restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I1b3f3a5cf20c1e7f8f419d07e382a03eea673f76

commit_message:
Finally remove the old data-utils

All active plugins now switched to new location of data-utils and
we are good to remove the old data-utils.

and patch can be merged once they fix the gate.
- https://review.opendev.org/c/x/ranger-tempest-plugin/+/768760

commit_message:
Remove update_initial_state() method from the HA router

This method was intended to check state of the HA router on the
node and update it in the neutron server.
Patch [1] added check of the initial status to the
neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor process.
It also could cause some race conditions and event which is setting
correct state of the router will be not processed thus router may endup
with two nodes with "primary" state in the Neutron's DB.

Neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor was notifying agent about
router's initial state only if this state was 'primary'.
Now it will notify agent always to let agent set router's state as
'backup' if needed (that was previously done by this removed
update_initial_state() method).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/642295

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py
    neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py

Change-Id: I2cc58c30cf844ee0ecf0611ecdec430086464790
Closes-Bug: #1916022
(cherry picked from commit 0d8ae1576724b196580c9af3782fd3c9e9072bef)

subject: [OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs
messages: [{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-03-10 10:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-11 14:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 10:34:03.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on provnet
ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver. Without
these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries and won't
send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries will never
arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on provnet
ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver. Without
these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries and won't
send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries will never
arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)

commit_message:
Synchronise kolla-ansible installation with other branches

In stable/train, installing kolla-ansible system-wide on CentOS 8 failed
with:

    ERROR: Cannot uninstall 'PyYAML'. It is a distutils installed
    project and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong
    to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall.

This change switched to using pip --user when installing kolla-ansible,
as done in change Ifaf1948ed5d42eebaa62d7bad375bbfc12b134d5.

This is cherry-picked to stable/ussuri so that all supported branches
use similar code.

Change-Id: I4ac15e8ac4e2484e4aee0e942fabc2453a09d168
(cherry picked from commit a919fbcc3517ed355221e3d6888e6806616a40e8)

commit_message:
Fix tripleo_network config conditional

The conditional used in the NetworkConfig block always
evaluates to conclude that network config should be
applied.

Use | int filter on the slurped os-net-config return
code file so that the condition does not always evaluate
to False.

Since the molecule test is'nt working, also change it
to use the delegate driver. Create a dummy0 interface, and
change the IP addresses used to the 203.0.113.0/24
TEST-NET-3[1] range to avoid conflicts.

[1] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5737

Closes-Bug: #1918372
Change-Id: Ia4d663cd298556c8143eab6e799e68c81bc8235e

On the one hand, it seems awfully late to be adding something to the ussuri release. With the switch to this being an independent deliverable, is a cycle-based stable branch still needed here?

https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/78d0577401838b7066341572346f7e7e99640d40'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-01 15:11:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> On the one hand, it seems awfully late to be adding something to the ussuri release. With the switch to this being an independent deliverable, is a cycle-based stable branch still needed here?
> 
> https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/78d0577401838b7066341572346f7e7e99640d40

Indeed this project is now independent so technically I think it could be ignored, however I think it's worth to catch this case now by creating the branch at the right point to avoid this in future (hypothetical). We have suffered enough from similar issues over the past few weeks to secure it now while it is still hot rather than ignore it and to face the same situation and reask the same questions in few months.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-03 12:40:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Here is my vote to give my position about this topic.

I'll be happy to discuss with you if we want to continue or not and to measure the pro and con.

For me the rationale behind these changes are enough worthful to allow us to continue.

Notice that I only +1 to avoid to hide possible -1."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-03 13:16:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Here is a more or less related topic https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo-ipsec/+bug/1917327

In the current case (this patch) we didn't released the same changes twice but we met more or less the same condition here, so I think we should consider that point.

As Murphy said, anything that can go wrong will go wrong.

The paint of this topic is still enough fresh so I think we should address this point now rather than abandonned it for now and reask the same question in few months. For now we know what's go wrong.

Notice that the pbr issue is now solved by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/776206/

If we decide to continue here we will avoid the pbr problem."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-03-03 15:25:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> On the one hand, it seems awfully late to be adding something to the ussuri release. With the switch to this being an independent deliverable, is a cycle-based stable branch still needed here?
> 
> https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/78d0577401838b7066341572346f7e7e99640d40

Hi Sean

yeah indeed - I mean, to be clear, this isn't a case of us actually *needing* the ussuri branch. We aren't using the project since before the U cycle (hence why we didn't notice about this missing branch). 

I posted this patch on a prompt from Herve - it was my understanding that this would help to fix something in the release jobs that was broken by the missing branch.

thanks"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-03-03 15:26:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Here is a more or less related topic https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo-ipsec/+bug/1917327
> 
> In the current case (this patch) we didn't released the same changes twice but we met more or less the same condition here, so I think we should consider that point.
> 
> As Murphy said, anything that can go wrong will go wrong.
> 
> The paint of this topic is still enough fresh so I think we should address this point now rather than abandonned it for now and reask the same question in few months. For now we know what's go wrong.
> 
> Notice that the pbr issue is now solved by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/776206/
> 
> If we decide to continue here we will avoid the pbr problem.

thanks Herve for your work here.


As I just replied to Sean - we don't actually *need* a stable/ussuri for tripleo, but, I am happy to land this change if it will help us to avoid any release related issues in the future.

thank you"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-03-03 15:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-05 17:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also I think that we should consider EM/EOL things during our discussion about this kind of problem.

They risk to emerge again at this time'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:02:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I'm fine with it"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-11 13:06:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We didn't get new feedback since 10 days, I think we can go ahead.
Added to our meeting agenda to move further and give a last chance to people to raise hand."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:50:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Expose 'availability_zone_hints' for OS::Neutron::Router and OS::Neutron::Net.

Since our implementation of multi-site network requires the correct availability_zone
for router and network, we are dependent on the possibility of defining the
availability_zone for a given router/network. When defining neutron objects from the
command-line, the availability_zone can be pre-determined by specifying a list of
availability_zone_hints.

This patch exposes this property within a heat-template.

Change-Id: I156314a658e6e704ee460a6e2024e6217972af7e

[{'created': '2017-10-21 16:48:37.000000000', 'message': "Support backoff retry on check resource action complete

Change to use tenacity as the retry library for check resource
completion.
Use exponential backoff retry waiting time to reduce the tension
of rechecking every seconds before exception, completed or
timeout.
Since we use backoff retry, we don't really need to yield anything
even with PollDelay raised.
Closes-Bugs: #1725731

Change-Id: Ia39d804f9b1201aad15c39adafc77d210fcd945a
"}]
commit_message:
Support backoff retry on check resource action complete

Change to use tenacity as the retry library for check resource
completion.
Use exponential backoff retry waiting time to reduce the tension
of rechecking every seconds before exception, completed or
timeout.
Since we use backoff retry, we don't really need to yield anything
even with PollDelay raised.
Closes-Bugs: #1725731

Change-Id: Ia39d804f9b1201aad15c39adafc77d210fcd945a

recheck

timed out accessing upper-constraints from git.o.o'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-08 13:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-10 16:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-24 12:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

This should be done in the external plugin.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-24 13:46:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thomas,

I am not really sure about that. Tempest plugins are supposed to be simple pip-installable packages, usually they are pip-installed from master (or whatever version) right into the tempest's virtualenv (that's what TEMPEST_PLUGINS var does AFAIR).

I don't know of any tempest plugin that also has a devstack plugin. The options we set in the tempest config are originating from heat's devstack plugin so it is more straightforward to set them here.

With this patch I'm trying to start decoupling heat's testing from devstack-gate hooks and move the logic to zuul3 playbooks / devstack plugin, since AFAIU devstack-gate would be gone at some point.."}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2017-11-24 13:56:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

You're right, it's not really what I meant. I meant: let's do the move first. We should refactor the infra later."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-24 13:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

completely fair.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-25 15:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-14 19:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

Interestingly, here is a guy who wants to give heat-tempest-plugin its own devstack plugin: I9fba58f475195e20d8dcec4f65a18f86a8a78ba2. Which appears to be not as unusual as I thought: https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/plugin-registry.html

Anyhow, setting -W because now the plugin split has happened we'd have to rethink this."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-15 07:30:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Zane,

I'm still trying to wrap my head around what's left in the heat tree, and what has moved to the tempest plugin (and on what classification of tests was that split made).

The biggest trouble with heat tests as of now is that they do not create all the resources they need for tests themselves (IMO only image ref's and optionally flavor ref's should be required) - which is not how most of the other tempest tests behave.

Besides, having all of the 'preparation' code in the devstack-gate hooks is cumbersome, I'd think first of all for developers who set up local devstack instances. That was the reason for this patch, as having this logic in the devstack plugin is much clearer IMO (until Heat tests can prepare all the needed infra pieces themselves).

So the question for now is - what do the tests left in the Heat tree need from 'resources pre-created' perspective? (user/project created, networks/subnets etc)? If none, then we can move this logic to a potential devstack plugin of tempest plugin (as those tests definitely need this). Otherwise these should be left in the Heat devstack plugin (as obviously there's little point in installing heat-tempest-plugin w/o heat itself)."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:31:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I'm not really an expert on this, but maybe I can clarify a bit.

- The heat-tempest-plugin tests need to work standalone... ideally regardless of whether they're run from devstack or not.
- The in-tree heat_integration_tests always run the heat-tempest-plugin tests as well. You can consider it a superset.
- I'm not sure where the bits that need precreated resources ended up. All of the scenario tests are in heat-tempest-plugin, so I'm guessing that's most of them.
- There is definitely a point in installing heat-tempest-plugin without Heat (although arguably not in devstack): the idea of heat-tempest-plugin is that people can run it against a cloud to validate it, not just in CI (which is the only place we run heat_integrationtests)."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-15 18:28:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I've meant installing a devstack with heat-tempest-plugin's devstack plugin (if it ever gets one) without heat's devstack plugin.

Actually the bit of installing heat's tempest plugin separately is my biggest trouble now. We are building a unified docker container for internal CI that bears tempest and plugins for all 'pluggable' services. Heat's one is pain in this regard :-("}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-15 20:54:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Yeah, let's fix that."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 18:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandon as this been no activity over an year, please restore this if you whould like to keep this work going'}]

commit_message:
Refactor heat integration tests infra

devstack supports a 'test-conig' setup phase where it can setup tempest
and its config appropriately.

Move the code from prepare_test_env.sh and prepare_test_network.sh
directly into a heat's devstack plugin function that will be called
in that phase.
Couple of new devstack plugin settings are introduced as a side effect.

Change-Id: I6e70c81b9388880e00e1eccb3de634e89317289e

[{'created': '2021-03-11 10:00:55.000000000', 'message': '[L3] Delete DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings after no gw ports

This is the code behavior aligning for dvr related logical. The
L3 dvr DB will remove all related FIP agent gateway port after there
is no real use of it. But the DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings remain,
it will cause the issue of new floating IP failed to bind. This
patch adds the binding deleting action.

Related-bug: #1883089
Change-Id: I62c29e172bc8705dade11d37bb347241ef8ad5f8
(cherry picked from commit 8dee0d9a4eb4282b989f2c77a79e55aa89554788)

commit_message:
[L3] Delete DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings after no gw ports

This is the code behavior aligning for dvr related logical. The
L3 dvr DB will remove all related FIP agent gateway port after there
is no real use of it. But the DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings remain,
it will cause the issue of new floating IP failed to bind. This
patch adds the binding deleting action.

Related-bug: #1883089
Change-Id: I62c29e172bc8705dade11d37bb347241ef8ad5f8
(cherry picked from commit 8dee0d9a4eb4282b989f2c77a79e55aa89554788)

- gate-grenade-dsvm-heat-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/62/504862/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-heat-ubuntu-xenial/0820e54/ : SUCCESS in 1h 02m 49s

I wonder if we really want to do this, given that people might be using them as a backup? If they delete their server then they also lose their backups at the same time...'}, {'account_id': 8289, 'date': '2017-09-23 07:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Zane,
We delete the snapshot images for server resource when deleting stack, this is the current behavior of stack deleting. This bug happens when deleting stack and if one/several servers have been removed before. I delete the snapshot images which exist in the stack snapshot data, which not mean to delete all snapshot images of the server in  environment.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-09-25 21:11:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm just thinking about the case where e.g. you accidentally replace a server. Before if there was a snapshot around you could still restore it. Now IIUC it will be deleted too.

I agree that it's a problem that snapshots are getting left behind after we've deleted the whole stack."}, {'account_id': 27248, 'date': '2018-02-22 14:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I'm just thinking about the case where e.g. you accidentally
 > replace a server. Before if there was a snapshot around you could
 > still restore it. Now IIUC it will be deleted too.
 > 
 > I agree that it's a problem that snapshots are getting left behind
 > after we've deleted the whole stack.

Hi Zane, could you please explain on "accidentally replace the server" scenario.
I think cleaning the snapshots in case of delete action would be must.
Alternatively, could there be a prompt or something to clean snapshots as well. Or set some property in template to preserve snapshots etc.

Thanks,
Prateek'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-07 11:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi as we now migrated from Launchpad to StoryBoard ( https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project_group/82 ), we needs to link from your patch to StoryBoard, as for how to provide the link, please reference `How to connect from Gerrit to StoryBoard` section in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Heat-StoryBoard-Migration-Info
Please help to add those keys to your commit message. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-12 11:35:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Hi huangtianhua, are you still working on this bug?:)

Prateek the snapshot is used to recover instance, that's why with delete instance command, Nova would not do us a favor to directly remove all snapshot.

Another way to solve this is by provide option to allow reserved/removed snapshot for stack update/delete command"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 18:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandon as this been no activity over an year, please restore this if you whould like to keep this work going'}]

"}]
commit_message:
Delete the snapshot images when delete server

To delete the snapshot images when delete the server
resource, to make sure the snapshot images won't left.

Change-Id: I46cc26c4786b08f3197da7328f319bcfb91f8b8e
Closes-Bug: #1716845

commit_message:
Add qos_policy property to floatingip resource

neutron has enabled floating-ip-rate-limit[1]
this enable to create floatingip and set bandwith in qos_policy

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/floating-ip-rate-limit
Change-Id: I6a9bccc8d6f918cf73d521499aa494ee9144448c

commit_message:
Add validation for resource name arg to functions

Now StackValidation fail error with corresponding path is
returned to user in the case if resource_name argument to
get_attr or get_resource functions has incorrect type.

Change-Id: I1996162dc0d19173666ba71d9d2b39bece2e5788

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-12-30 09:57:15.000000000', 'message': "Handle network property for Server on cancel-update

This patch add special logic for handling network properties for server
resource during replace. Previously cancel update for Server resource
with specified network property failed due to attempt to attach
interface deleted by nova (because ports created by nova, will be
deleted during detach interface).

This patch has check for convergence enable, because for convergence we
execute rollback from old resource, but for legacy code it's different.

Change-Id: Ice6c7d839aae249e55cfe4814509e617aeae4e6d

commit_message:
Handle network property for Server on cancel-update

This patch add special logic for handling network properties for server
resource during replace. Previously cancel update for Server resource
with specified network property failed due to attempt to attach
interface deleted by nova (because ports created by nova, will be
deleted during detach interface).

Related-Bug: #1570908

Change-Id: Ice6c7d839aae249e55cfe4814509e617aeae4e6d

subject: Fix cache storing problem

(1 comment)

> What will be, if we stack-delete operation replace with
 > stack-update? Does this issue not reproduced during update or your
 > patch handles such case?
Thanks for notes, Peter.
Yes, in that case issue will be reproduced, but only if stack is updated via update-replace. Because without update-replace resource id will remain the same, cached value will be valid and will not be deleted. But in case of update-replace handle_delete will be called, cache invalidated, etc. So, this patch handles such situations too.
Do you think, I should mention this scenario in commit message?'}, {'account_id': 20559, 'date': '2016-09-07 14:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, about scenarios this patch does not handle, there is one.
1. Some resource X is created outside of Heat (via neutron cli, for example).
2. This resource is used in stack A (call to neutron for resource X is cached).
3. Stack A is deleted.
4. Resource X is deleted.
5. Stack B is created, using reference to resource X.
6. Creation will fail because cache for resource X call to neutron is not cleared.

It is very rare situation, I suppose, but probability still exists. To resolve it, we need to somehow invalidate all cached calls, used during stack lifetime.

I would be glad, if you share your opinion about this situation.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2016-09-08 04:19:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As mentioned in the bug, I'm not comfortable with this approach. You can easily disable the resource_finder_cache or reduce the TTL if you want create/delete/create a resource with the same name.

Having said that I can remove my -1, if others are ok with it."}, {'account_id': 13009, 'date': '2016-09-08 12:05:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Rabi, if caching works incorrectly in some case - it's not user problem, user is not obliged to research, why heat not works and why caching should be disabled. It's developer problem, so should be fixed - for correct caching. So, IMO, it's useful patch and has a right to be landed in heat:)"}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2016-09-08 15:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I would also like to see less code duplication'}, {'account_id': 7253, 'date': '2016-09-08 15:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am agree with Rabi, maybe the default value of 'expiration_time' is too large, reduce it, then it will clear the cache automatically. So IMO we don't have to clear additionally."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-03-07 15:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I don't see how "change a setting that only the cloud operator has access to" is an acceptable answer to a bug.  As a heat user I don't necessarily have the ability to do that.  And since it's the default I would expect most clouds to be running with the broken value.

I also don't think that changing the cache TTL is a solution.  That might make this happen less often, but when I iterate on a stack I often start a re-deployment as soon as the previous one finishes deleting.  I'm not sure how you could find a TTL that provides a useful level of caching and avoids this problem in that case.

Besides which, it seems clear to me that the cache behavior is wrong here.  An operation has happened that should have invalidated the cache entry, but it didn't.  The cache is returning stale data.

I can't really comment on the implementation, but if there's concern about how this patch works then maybe it could switch to an EAFP model?  If a resource lookup fails then invalidate the cache entry and try again?  It might be a little slower, but I think it would handle the deleted and re-created external resource case too.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2017-03-20 03:42:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

>And since it's the default I would expect most clouds to be running with the broken value.

Not sure I understand. Global toggle for caching is disabled by default[1]. Heat config defaults would not be effective.

The reason I'm not in favor is, we should not make the plugins unnecessarily complicated for cache invalidation, which they have no clue about(whether enabled or not).

If there is a use-case to create and delete resources with same name again and again, we should not enable global cache.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.cache/tree/oslo_cache/_opts.py#n57"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-03-20 17:54:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> >And since it's the default I would expect most clouds to be
 > running with the broken value.
 > 
 > Not sure I understand. Global toggle for caching is disabled by
 > default[1]. Heat config defaults would not be effective.

Ah, I was just looking at the resource_finder_cache opt.  I guess devstack must turn on global caching by default though.

That does mitigate the problem, but the bug still seems like it severely limits the usefulness of caching.  As a cloud operator, you have to know exactly how your users are going to use heat, and that usage has to not include repeated deploys of the same stack.

 > [1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.cache/tree/oslo_cache/_opts.py#n57"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-23 08:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-26 17:00:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I agree with Rabi, I don't want to make resource plugins responsible for clearing the cache. We need to either make caching Just Work(TM) (possibly by adding the root stack ID in the cache key) or get rid of it altogether so users can't turn it on."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-07 10:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Please help to add those keys to your commit message. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 18:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandon as this been no activity over an year, please restore this if you whould like to keep this work going'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-07 11:44:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cache storing problem

This patch fixes situation where:
1. Stack A created.
2. Stack B which uses resources from stack A
(referenced by name or id) is created.
3. Both stacks are deleted.
4. Stack C created with same resource names as in Stack A.
5. Stack D created which uses resources from stack C.
6. Creation of stack D is failed due to the fact
that cache still contains old values from stack A.

Now, when cacheable resource is deleted it also
invalidates (clears) its cache.

Also, cache backend is changed from dogpile.cache.memory to
dogpile.cache.memcached.
Using of Memory backend is discouraged
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.cache/blob/master/oslo_cache/testing.py#L39-L47
With Memory backend cache behaves strange with convergence enabled
(and approach used in this patch will not fix the bug without
changing cache backend).

Closes-bug: #1609787
Change-Id: I8a0790f0f7c62e1727b144628da97006c3c9679e
'}, {'created': '2016-09-09 09:41:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix cache storing problem

commit_message:
Fix cache storing problem

This patch fixes situation where:
1. Stack A created.
2. Stack B which uses resources from stack A
(referenced by name or id) is created.
3. Both stacks are deleted.
4. Stack C created with same resource names as in Stack A.
5. Stack D created which uses resources from stack C.
6. Creation of stack D is failed due to the fact
that cache still contains old values from stack A.

Now, when cacheable resource is deleted it also
invalidates (clears) its cache.

Also, cache backend is changed from dogpile.cache.memory to
dogpile.cache.memcached.
Using of Memory backend is discouraged
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.cache/blob/master/oslo_cache/testing.py#L39-L47
With Memory backend cache behaves strange with convergence enabled
(and approach used in this patch will not fix the bug without
changing cache backend).

Cache clear occurs only if cache set to enabled in heat.conf

Closes-bug: #1609787
Change-Id: I8a0790f0f7c62e1727b144628da97006c3c9679e

(1 comment)

> Hmm, I'd have expected this to have been resolved by the fix for
 > bug 1538551. It's definitely surprising that there appears to be
 > code here for ignoring errors in the *new* properties... that
 > doesn't seem right.

It's intended to ignore errors in the old stack's properties during
update, and it seems to do that in my tests.  If you update a stack
that has been created/update with this invalid template
http://paste.openstack.org/show/507328/, stack validation always fails
at
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/51ec49a/heat/engine/resource.py#L878
due to the old resource.

 > (Reviewing offline, so I can't read the bug report ATM)

I think this patch will be a little clearer after reading the bug
report.  I'll add some more comments in the code."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2016-06-11 01:19:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Allow a stack with invalid resolved properties to be updated

Whenever a stack has a resource with a property that resolves to an
incorrect type, we should still be able to update the stack with a
valid template.

Change-Id: Ic22c4c61019db85dd0f06e592f0653b38e327560
Closes-Bug: #1588431

commit_message:
Don't set stack to FAILED if rollback enable

Don't set stack to FAILED before stack rollback,
to avoid the stack_resource check update fail.

Change-Id: I0c1723ef2e0766fa69b887c74addcef4c1a22227
Closes-Bug: #1693985

commit_message:
Update defn of resource if its update cancelled

If cancel came in the middle of update handler task,
the resource was updated partially, so update the
defn to prepare for rollback.

Change-Id: Id5e56a3214e241817ae4a6cb5518a58a9fe12f91
Closes-Bug: #1693495

commit_message:
Support to boot nova server with tags

Before this patch we set tags for server after
the server created complete, since microversion 2.52
nova supports to boot server with tags, so we
can change the logic of tags setting.

Change-Id: I2e9456bf0a39ca305125075c6aaddd74b8fe5d9c
Closes-Bug: #1708384

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-04 14:14:59.000000000', 'message': "update scenario.test_server_signal to use config

Update the heat_integrationtests.scenario.test_server_signal
test cases to make proper use of the heat_plugin
tempest configuration options:

   - use the conf.instance_type flavor in the
   test_server_signal_userdata_format_software_config instead
   of the conf.minimal_instance_type flavor
   - use the conf.floating_network_name network instead of
   the default 'public' network harcoded in the template file
   - use the conf.fixed_network_name network instead of
   the default 'heat-net' network harcoded in the template file

Change-Id: I9e2536189804c9a33db109cc0c2baa88c3fcf7c6
Closes-Bug: #1708668
"}]
commit_message:
update scenario.test_server_signal to use config

Update the heat_integrationtests.scenario.test_server_signal
test cases to make proper use of the heat_plugin
tempest configuration options:

   - use the conf.instance_type flavor in the
   test_server_signal_userdata_format_software_config instead
   of the conf.minimal_instance_type flavor
   - use the conf.floating_network_name network instead of
   the default 'public' network harcoded in the template file
   - use the conf.fixed_network_name network instead of
   the default 'heat-net' network harcoded in the template file

Change-Id: I9e2536189804c9a33db109cc0c2baa88c3fcf7c6
Closes-Bug: #1708668

commit_message:
Support 'tag' for device matadata tag

Nova supports device metadata tag since version 2.32.
This patch will support it in heat.
Change-Id: I00e9d7bbee62483a8a916a212d39218ab0d95a7c
Closes-Bug: #1657672

average of 14.02 seconds to create the stack without the patch, average of 13.48 seconds to create the stack with the patch. So, that's around a ~4% improvement. Not a huge improvement but an improvement nonetheless. TL;DR  This should be good to go after i remove the traceback logging. Sometimes we try to get a root_id when there won't be one but that's OK for now (and not a change in behaviour).

Speaking of that traceback, there are two irksome patterns where that occurs, seen here http://paste.openstack.org/show/564042/ . It has to do with validating a stack_resource before any parent stack has actually been created, so of course trying to get a root_id is not going to work. The first trace is with counting total_resources: nothing has been created yet, not even the root_id we want to count by. So, I'd prefer the code not even try but that could be the subject of another patch.

The 2nd is self-imposed from this patch by calling self.root_stack_id() which are doing just in case this a legacy stack where we need to find and back fill root_id's (maybe unnecessary, but a safe and inexpensive thing to do). 

  File "/opt/stack/new/heat/heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py", line 212, in _parse_nested_stack
    root_id=self.stack.root_stack_id(),'}, {'account_id': 13564, 'date': '2016-08-26 18:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-26 19:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-08-12 09:49:20.000000000', 'message': "Add root_id column to stack table

Before this patch, calls to Stack.get_root_id() ended up performing a
recursive db operation with as many calls as the depth of the (nested)
stack. This is mainly invoked when resources are created; if there
are 100 resources at an average stack depth of 20, that's about 2000
more db calls than we ought to need. With this patch, none of those
calls are necessary.

This patch also helps with quickly counting total resources
from anywhere within the nested stack.

Change-Id: I09b79e96900544e8633e7052ea21799502d18d4d

commit_message:
Add root_id column to stack table

Before this patch, calls to Stack.get_root_id() ended up performing a
recursive db operation with as many calls as the depth of the (nested)
stack. This is mainly invoked when resources are created; if there
are 100 resources at an average stack depth of 20, that's about 2000
more db calls than we ought to need. With this patch, none of those
calls are necessary.

Change-Id: I09b79e96900544e8633e7052ea21799502d18d4d
Story: #1677901
Task: 17225

Related-Bug: #1717918

commit_message:
Enable redelegation feature

When the reauthentication_auth_method = true, the openstack
resource component to create_trust has a 403 error.  For
example, Sahara creates a new trust using heat_trust_token
has a 403 error. Need to specify allow_redelegation=True
when heat creates trust.

Change-Id: I3667e3de2f2d574d3991742922a7401cc18b9081
Related-Bug: #1717918

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 12:17:44.000000000', 'message': 'Update auth_uri option and port 35357

This option is deprecated for removal since Queens.[1]
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

Before the Queens release,
keystone needed to be run on two separate ports to accommodate the Identity v2 API
which ran a separate admin-only service commonly on port 35357.
With the removal of the v2 API, keystone can be run on the same port for all interfaces.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I1033651db70c0a55231e436e907be232569e039f
'}]
commit_message:
Update auth_uri option and port 35357

This option is deprecated for removal since Queens.[1]
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

Before the Queens release,
keystone needed to be run on two separate ports to accommodate the Identity v2 API
which ran a separate admin-only service commonly on port 35357.
With the removal of the v2 API, keystone can be run on the same port for all interfaces.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I1033651db70c0a55231e436e907be232569e039f

commit_message:
Allow to specify a different region for the domain admin client

In a multi-region setup with a master Keystone and slaves replicating
user tables, Heat must create users in the master region to avoid
triggering replication failures.

Change-Id: I6b7911f7698502e3548bd40e91e5bff709232bec
Story: 2005653
Task: 30941

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17216, 'name': 'Martin Schuppert', 'email': 'mschuppert@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcschupp'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20733, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'ratailor@redhat.com', 'username': 'rajesht'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 15:39:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04a97f92e4d944ce51492011584e2ec1126042a1)

commit_message:
Add flake8-import-order extension

This adds the import order extension to match what we have in the cinder
repo. This is a linting extension that will check that imports are in
the correct order and the correct grouping so they automatically get
flagged, and it won't be whether reviewers notice and decide to do
anything or not.

Cinder change was Ic13ba238a4a45c6219f4de131cfe0366219d722f for a little
more wordy reasoning.

Also includes updates for noqa tags. Newer version of the linters appear
to want these on the function definition line, not on the decorator
line.

Change-Id: Ibf3f3afbf3bb6ec6613b35f91d4a353c6a391f41
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Seed the pseudo-random generator on service start

The heat engine uses random.randint() / random.uniform() to
introduce non-determenism in some retry/backoff functionality.

To avoid that every instance (which is likely started
at the same time) in a cluster installation runs with the same
seed, seed it on startup.

Change-Id: I203d0c77a6fc702137d1457a38aaa367d18e0bea

subject: Add initialization stack action
messages:
[{'account_id': 30531, 'date': '2019-05-31 14:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-05-31 16:00:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This doesn't handle nested stacks (in the sense that they won't be pre-initialised). Is that OK?

I'm not at all convinced that this is the right place to solve the problem, FWIW."}, {'account_id': 30531, 'date': '2019-06-12 16:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 30531, 'date': '2019-06-12 16:49:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

I don't think we would want nested stacks to be initialized. The top stack would not allocate resources, but simply store the template.

Where do you think would be a better place to solve? This solution allows gives the stack a completed state so that the timeout functionality does not throw errors and Heat knows not to keep querying the stack for when to start resource allocations."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-06-12 20:23:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Where do you think would be a better place to solve?

Ideally in Glare but, since that's long dead, in Blazar itself (possibly storing the template data somewhere external like Swift)."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-06-12 20:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30531, 'date': '2019-06-12 20:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30531, 'date': '2019-06-12 21:01:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30531, 'date': '2019-06-12 21:13:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

I think doing it in blazar would create a lot of redundancy between the projects in terms of handling templates.'}, {'account_id': 29270, 'date': '2019-08-02 19:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28935, 'date': '2019-08-14 15:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:43:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

We need functional test for this, also please also adding the logic from init to create and also make sure init will not be consider bad status for other actions'}]

commit_message:
Add initialization stack action

Allows users to initialize a stack without allocating resources. This
allows users to launch a stack at a future time by simply calling update
on the stack or for intigration into a reservation service like Blazar
to launch stack when a node reservations begin

Change-Id: Ie05b248a7270ac4d6d08a9b8accec7dd79b8ac12
Story: 2005652
Task: 30940

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I9902966892a1dc4f85d449dfe580fb128647487b

subject: GroupUserAssignment Resource: The resource adds users to a group
messages:
[{'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-05-30 13:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-30 13:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-05-30 14:10:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(6 comments)

You haven't said why we need this resource. I'm assuming it's because the users are already pre-created outside of Heat (based on some underlying IdP), but you want to assign them to groups?"}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-06-05 16:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-06-05 16:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30515, 'date': '2019-06-05 16:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-11-17 15:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think the test job failure because you didn't change 
heat_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_octavia_lbaas.py to adopt `max_retries_down` property"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-09-25 12:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 30456, 'date': '2019-09-27 06:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks for your code review.
yes, this related to heat_tempest_plugin。next, I will change it.'}, {'account_id': 30456, 'date': '2019-09-27 13:44:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I has  add the `max_retries_down ` in heat_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/templates/octavia_lbaas.yaml,
but it also check failure. That beause `test_octavia_lbaas.py` will called `heatclient/v1/stacks.py` to creat stacks, but before creat stacks heat will check property first.
It's a cycle, I don't know what I should do？"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandon as this been no activity over an year, please restore this if you whould like to keep this work going'}]

subject: change log level
messages:
[{'account_id': 30537, 'date': '2019-10-11 07:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-10-11 20:37:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

pep8 is complaining about the length of the line, not using exception() vs. debug():

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/14f5b053cf0e4e5f9802292e747e2df9/log/job-output.txt#722

exception() logs at ERROR level, so I agree with Rico that this should probably be at the DEBUG level. Some explanation of why this needs to be logged at all would be useful too.

This patch can never merge because it depends on the previous patch that you already abandoned (and which is also failing the gate because of the line length). You need to squash all of the changes into a single patch that passes the gate.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-10-12 07:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

please fix the pep8 error'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandon as this been no activity over an year, please restore this if you whould like to keep this work going'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-11 07:14:19.000000000', 'message': 'change log level

as is : LOG.exception(...) does not match pep8 standard.
to be : use LOG.debug(...)

Change-Id: Ibc60c19cae06a27af25be83963e20e8b7c102dab
'}]
commit_message:
change log level

as is : LOG.exception(...) does not match pep8 standard.
to be : use LOG.debug(...)

Change-Id: Ibc60c19cae06a27af25be83963e20e8b7c102dab

commit_message:
Validate signal/message transport

Some values for signal transport depend on external service being
available (Swift, Zaqar) but are not being validated. This leads to
late failures during the stack creation, and what is more, such failed
stacks might become non-deletable.

This patch adds validaiton of provided signal transports to the
resources that have such properties (HeatWaitConditionHandle, Server,
SofwareDeployment).

Change-Id: Ib3041c9e61b44c19d2d0aa10fcd3951baebdea57
Closes-Bug: #1542269

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-03 16:18:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix floatingip dependencies building

Add dependencies to router interface except such cases:
1. Floating ip doesn't set port property.
2. If router interface depends on some port with fixed_ips property in it
and fip has port with defined fixed_ips, we can compare both
fixed_ips lists and decide whether we need to add dependencies or not.
Both string values or dependencies on other resources can be in these lists.
In other cases we can't be sure and need to call neutron. However, dependencies
should be calculated fast and should not call any external API, so in another
situations we just assume, that we should add dependencies.
Dependencies now are calculated slightly different: now we biuld implicit
dependencies after building all explicit dependencies, because we need to
know all explicit deps during addition of implicit deps.
Because of removed call to neutron, this fixes one more bug.

Closes-Bug: #1629929
Closes-Bug: #1626619
Closes-Bug: #1626634
Change-Id: I688c399dd1589a80f990d0bf351a68090f56b264

commit_message:
Fix floatingip dependencies building

Add dependencies to router interface except such cases:

1. Floating ip doesn't set port property.
2. If router interface depends on some port with fixed_ips property in
   it and fip has port with defined fixed_ips, we can compare both
   fixed_ips lists and decide whether we need to add dependencies or not.

Both string values or dependencies on other resources can be in these
lists. In other cases we can't be sure and need to call neutron.
However, dependencies should be calculated fast and should not call any
external API, so in another situations we just assume, that we should
add dependencies.

Because of removed call to neutron, this fixes one more bug.

Closes-Bug: #1629929
Closes-Bug: #1626634
Change-Id: I688c399dd1589a80f990d0bf351a68090f56b264
