Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-08-14 16:04:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

recheck is used to re-run the CI jobs, sometimes there are false negatives, generally it's best to do "recheck bug ###" where ### is a launchpad bug describing the reason for the false CI error - then you can rank CI problems in http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/ whereas bare recheck doesn't help categorize the various issues that happen.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-18 18:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-15 12:19:12.000000000', 'message': "Imporve update preview logic

Current update preview logic might display not accurate information.
In case you try update preview along with the same template what you
used for the stack creation, and also the resource including
get_resource or other dependecy functions, you might get unexpected
result indicationg the resources will be updated even though you
didn't have any change for the template.

Change-Id: I7a12c6f16cf62589f9c199ec08f66c40e3dcd22f
Closes-Bug: #1691786

commit_message:
WIP: Imporve update preview logic

Current update preview logic might display not accurate information.
In case you try update preview along with the same template what you
used for the stack creation, and also the resource including
get_resource or other dependecy functions, you might get unexpected
result indicationg the resources will be updated even though you
didn't have any change for the template.

Change-Id: I7a12c6f16cf62589f9c199ec08f66c40e3dcd22f
Closes-Bug: #1691786

On closer inspection, this is eliminating too much.

We removed the ability to customise the username in the config, but the EC2 Instance resource still hard-codes the name to 'ec2-user', and this patch would ignore that."}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2019-11-25 16:10:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This patch has been flagged in the 2019 Heat Patch Triage Effort [0] as ready for abandonment.

Reasons for abandonment include inactivity for a lengthy period of time, triviality of the patch, inattentiveness to review feedback, and other reasons.

This patch has been targeted for forced abandonment by review.  If you don't mind this, then you have nothing to do.

If you believe this patch has value and has been selected for abandonment in error, please bring this patch up to standard and give a reason for its inclusion in the Heat project.

Thank you,
David Peacock
dpeacock@redhat.com

[0] https://ethercalc.openstack.org/b3qtqyhkg9g1"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 17:26:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Remove sudoers injection part of the heat boot scripts

The ability to customize the instance_user was removed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103928/ so we can
remove the remaining code that looks slightly scary
in touching sudoers dynamically.

Related-Bug: #1257410
Change-Id: Ia98b49678af192a09812126ba33dfead34d7ef75

Improve curl download

- Add -f and -S option to see the actual error
- Combined all options at one
- Increased number of retries to 5

subject: Add 'is_enabled' attr to segment
messages:
[{'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2020-03-30 09:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2020-03-30 09:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/enable-to-segment'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2020-06-03 01:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32304, 'date': '2020-11-04 07:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

do we need a release note here?'}, {'account_id': 32304, 'date': '2021-01-07 09:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-01-07 12:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think one releasenote for the feature "enabled to segment" is enough.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-01-26 09:50:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

yeah, I think nobody really reads clients' notes; it would make more sense if we added something generally missing and not just adapting the client to the new version of server; i.e. I don't care whether we have a reno here or not, it's not the most important thing and I have just probably written more words than it would have 😊"}, {'account_id': 32304, 'date': '2021-01-26 09:52:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

alright, if both of you feel that way about it I'll +2"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-01-26 09:55:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

but there is another problem with this in that we should really hide the 'enabled' flag behind a microversion guard as previous microversions did not include it and will break on it; we are bumping the microversion in the API part so are prepared there"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-01-26 10:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-02-20 08:31:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> but there is another problem with this in that we should really hide the 'enabled' flag behind a microversion guard as previous microversions did not include it and will break on it; we are bumping the microversion in the API part so are prepared there

As I know, the former masakari team intended to deprecate masakari CLI since Train, to switch to osc.
So a new patch will replace this one."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-20 09:38:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > but there is another problem with this in that we should really hide the 'enabled' flag behind a microversion guard as previous microversions did not include it and will break on it; we are bumping the microversion in the API part so are prepared there
> 
> As I know, the former masakari team intended to deprecate masakari CLI since Train, to switch to osc.
> So a new patch will replace this one.

Yeah, we can drop it as OSC has, as far as I know, 100% coverage of Masakari API functions. However, do note the OSC plugin is actually right in this repo as well. And yes, we should add this functionality to OSC one. I missed it. Thanks for noticing!

Masakari CLI was deprecated in Stein already. [1]

I have added this to the next meeting's agenda. [2]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-masakariclient/stein.html
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/Masakari#Agenda_for_the_next_meeting"}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-03-04 07:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-03-05 01:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-03-05 01:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

OpenstackSDK rely on masakariclient/osc, so it needs to extend in masakariclient/osc to support microversion 1.2.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-03-05 01:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-09 20:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-09 20:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I had to fix several things to get it to at least try to set values on create and update. Masakari API needs fixing still. As well as tests. I also need to gather information on why OSDK does not convert the type of is_enabled automatically.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-09 20:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

We should preserve the pre-1.2 tests and add new ones. We should also test the fix in the helper method if we are forced to keep using it.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2021-03-10 03:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> I had to fix several things to get it to at least try to set values on create and update. Masakari API needs fixing still. As well as tests. I also need to gather information on why OSDK does not convert the type of is_enabled automatically.

Boolean type True, False is malformed in request body. The request body just support true, false.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-10 10:13:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> > Patch Set 6:
> > 
> > I had to fix several things to get it to at least try to set values on create and update. Masakari API needs fixing still. As well as tests. I also need to gather information on why OSDK does not convert the type of is_enabled automatically.
> 
> Boolean type True, False is malformed in request body. The request body just support true, false.

Yeah, that's another issue. The issue is validators don't even allow the 'enabled' field to be present."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-10 18:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

we have to merge the following two stacks to get create/update working with the "enabled" flag server-side:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/masakari/+/779797
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/masakari/+/779843'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-10 20:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

This works. There are no relevant tests (and they really need some love) but now the client is able to manipulate this flag properly.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1

yeas, we got osdk release ffe https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/780013
gtg'}]

commit_message:
[stable] Drop lower-constraints job

As discussed in neutron team meeting [1], it is not worth fixing issues
identified by new pip resolver in stable branches. So let's drop the job

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html#l-164

For stein branch, sync pylint test-requirements with neutron ones, as
current ones would require newer astroid (spotted with new pip
resolver). Also update psutil functional test requirement (syncing with
neutron stein version), as detected by new pip resolver.

Conflicts:
	lower-constraints.txt
	zuul.d/project.yaml

Change-Id: I96c59b2e6697d65184e87b731682fd7441519c89
(cherry picked from commit d07317b60e6d46aabc3a6e878924923a07661e75)

The 5.0.3 release of ansible-lint makes the linters job fail, due to the
addition of an unnamed-task rule. We have quite a large number of
unnamed tasks, typically include_tasks or include_role. We may want to
address this at some point, but not right now.

Change-Id: I4ee706fe2463d62e4e16412117d4373748ea43e3
(cherry picked from commit 32f1b6cf56f3e9678b909e0f7ca3922c3bc44f79)

commit_message:
ansible-lint: add unnamed-task to the skip list

The 5.0.3 release of ansible-lint makes the linters job fail, due to the
addition of an unnamed-task rule. We have quite a large number of
unnamed tasks, typically include_tasks or include_role. We may want to
address this at some point, but not right now.

Change-Id: I4ee706fe2463d62e4e16412117d4373748ea43e3
(cherry picked from commit 32f1b6cf56f3e9678b909e0f7ca3922c3bc44f79)

subject: Part 6 - Add RBAC protection tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 08:43:13.000000000', 'message': 'Part 6 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- shares (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share replicas (GET, POST, DELETE)
- share types (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share type extra specs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)

Change-Id: I6e6cbe66af177af79514c37a4748429744255d0c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Part 6 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- shares (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share replicas (GET, POST, DELETE)
- share types (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share type extra specs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)

Change-Id: I6e6cbe66af177af79514c37a4748429744255d0c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
jobs: remove devstack-gate references

Not needed by native Zuul v3 jobs.

Conflicts:
        zuul.d/tempest-singlenode.yaml
The conflicts are due to the evolution of the jobs definition
(a new job was added after victoria, and other changes).

Change-Id: Ia1e7d35f0c81cc5df792f4227d8e091080af65f1

I don't see any evidence that this is actually correct. The example in the Nova API docs is:

        "addresses": {
            "private": [
                {
                    "OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr": "00:0c:29:0d:11:74",
                    "OS-EXT-IPS:type": "fixed",
                    "addr": "192.168.1.30",
                    "version": 4
                }
            ]
        },

of which the client returns the list of "addr" values. Testing on a real cloud seems to confirm that it doesn't return a separate entry for the MAC.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:23:01.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Don't think we need this, feel free to restore anytime:)"}]

commit_message:
Fix Remove revoked ceph apt-keys

when running the playbook it does appens that the apt_key task fails.
let's retry in case of failure to mimic the apt-key add that runs later.

Change-Id: Ie745496f515af1461bb8d03ba6b5c7cac5e71150

subject: Dropping lower constraints testing
messages: [{'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 13:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:11:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nAre we sure we want to drop this. We have fixed the issues with the new resolver.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 13:36:36.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

Drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019672.html

Change-Id: I7434e6ae23c8bcdeccc93f441efe3d0dfdd56541
'}]
commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

Drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019672.html

Change-Id: I7434e6ae23c8bcdeccc93f441efe3d0dfdd56541

commit_message:
Regenerate trust when update with different user

Regenerate trust when update stack with different user
We will regenerate (and delete old trust) when user credential
doesn't match with current context (means different user is
operating).

Story: #1752347
Task: #17352

Change-Id: I39795bdbd8ab255150153bf8b1e165b49e1a7027

commit_message:
Use neutron client for server.addresses

The server.addresses (/servers/{server_id}/ips)
endpoint can contain stale data causing attribute
lookups to fail.

This change replaces the use of server.addresses
and instead uses the neutron client to list ports
with 'device_id' matching the server id.

Story: 2008632
Task: 41843
Related: RHBZ#1902230
Change-Id: I1b9293041f2ad92eac0e9bc9646e7b2d7c6f7fd0

commit_message:
Removes unneeded zuul layout overrides - templates for consistency

As part of [1] this removes the unneeded zuul layout overrides.
All the jobs removed here are already included with the relevant
templates. The files: matches that were used for the scenario
standalones are moved to the template layout via the depends-on.

The build-containers-ubi8 job is not needed as it is exercised
by the content providers and we have removed this job from other
tripleo layouts.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce
Depends-On: I633bc01bc1a8cd8d1216e503eaa9a43aef9a7fa0

commit_message:
Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times

It can happen that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE gets interpreted as a boolean
and not as a string. This has the consequence that python
when calling subprocess.run() will call os.fsencode() on the
boolean variable and we can get the following error:

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/
usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 423, in run\n    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 729, in __init__\n    restore_signals, start_new_session
)\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 1275, in _execute_child\n    env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/os.py\", line 800, in fsencode\n    filename = fspath(f
ilename)  # Does type-checking of `filename`.\nTypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not bool\n",
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "command": "/var/lib/container-config-scripts/pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh cinder_volume openstack-cinder-volume openstack-cinder-volume Started",
            "environment": {
                "TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE": true
            },

Let's force it to be a string so we can never hit this.

Tested on the provided reproducer.

Change-Id: Ia4caa36a6edd865b3e1dcdf9254c7f183b64faaf
Closes-Bug: #1918111

This patch introduces two new tasks to selectively create

commit_message:
Build osd caps section when there's at least >= 1 pool

When Ceph is deployed by TripleO but no services using
it are explicitly enabled in TripleO, an empty pool list
if generated (for the same reason), and the osd caps
results in an empty string, turning the cluster in a
non healthy status.
This patch introduces two new tasks to selectively create
osd caps when profiles >= 0.

Closes-Bug: #1917440
Change-Id: Id165c19121c9036a33b10d6b6d51f3bdc528307b
(cherry picked from commit 594642ba8f4ce9315974578228417a3ca22975fb)

commit_message:
Fix multicast scenario test

This patch changes multicast scenario test to run tcpdump on the
"unregistered" host always with specific interface, so that interface
is switched to the promiscuous mode.
It also adds option "-c 1" to the same tcpdump to be sure that it is killed
after it captures one packet.

In OVN job on Ussuri OVN 20.03 is used and IGMP Snooping requires a
least OVN 20.12 so in that version snooping is disabled.

This also reverts commit 193f1714bf4b2cf9bcdee89c0a646cab84544f10 which
marked that multicast scenario test as unstable.

Closes-Bug: #1850288

Change-Id: Ia3c84134a3e0543687ef715025d70f42e4b6826c

there zuul v3 syntax and job is run differently.
In that branch which still uses legacy zuul syntax the

commit_message:
[Functional tests] Set proper user name in the CI job

This patch is not needed in branches newer than rocky as we are using
there zuul v3 syntax and job is run differently.
In that branch which still uses legacy zuul syntax the
tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh script is setting "zuul" as
STACK_USER but later tests are run as "stack" user and that is causing
some problems with tests which needs to use sudo.

Change-Id: I6e8f2202c81bf0b600ad787cb4b36953d2f3969a

commit_message:
Remove update_initial_state() method from the HA router

This method was intended to check state of the HA router on the
node and update it in the neutron server.
Patch [1] added check of the initial status to the
neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor process.
It also could cause some race conditions and event which is setting
correct state of the router will be not processed thus router may endup
with two nodes with "primary" state in the Neutron's DB.

Neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor was notifying agent about
router's initial state only if this state was 'primary'.
Now it will notify agent always to let agent set router's state as
'backup' if needed (that was previously done by this removed
update_initial_state() method).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/642295

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
    neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py
    neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_keepalived_state_change.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py

Change-Id: I2cc58c30cf844ee0ecf0611ecdec430086464790
Closes-Bug: #1916022
(cherry picked from commit 0d8ae1576724b196580c9af3782fd3c9e9072bef)

commit_message:
Remove update_initial_state() method from the HA router

This method was intended to check state of the HA router on the
node and update it in the neutron server.
Patch [1] added check of the initial status to the
neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor process.
It also could cause some race conditions and event which is setting
correct state of the router will be not processed thus router may endup
with two nodes with "primary" state in the Neutron's DB.

Neutron_keepalived_state_change_monitor was notifying agent about
router's initial state only if this state was 'primary'.
Now it will notify agent always to let agent set router's state as
'backup' if needed (that was previously done by this removed
update_initial_state() method).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/642295

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
    neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py
    neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_keepalived_state_change.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py

Change-Id: I2cc58c30cf844ee0ecf0611ecdec430086464790
Closes-Bug: #1916022
(cherry picked from commit 0d8ae1576724b196580c9af3782fd3c9e9072bef)

commit_message:
Fix PKCS#11 reinitialization after failure

This patch fixes an error condition where the PCKS#11 object is lost
afte multiple failures from the PKCS#11 device.

Without this patch Barbican can enter an error state where the PKCS11
object is deallocated and is unable to recover returning 500s until the
process is restarted.

Story: 2008649
Task: 41913
Change-Id: Ieab0f152ef307fb9311b92f0ad8bd0032e78269e
(cherry picked from commit fa7722bfc5bb615d7d63ca8367b5c4b5e647d5d6)
(cherry picked from commit 3d3e00a92ac517f92847fb204406e898b663da08)
(cherry picked from commit 475074a47c09b54ef58e73fefafe5fcbf2d9c0f5)

commit_message:
Check Ceph cluster healthy state before starting FS to BS playbook

The Ceph OSDs migration from filestore to bluestore should only be
attempted if the cluster is in HEALTH_OK state because during the
process OSDs will be destroyed and recreated.

This change adds a check to poll for the cluster status before the
playbook is triggered.

Change-Id: Ib9c90c4c2e838bed461ac63139b161ab689d28cf
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/775669
Closes-Bug: 1915700

(see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/626183).

commit_message:
apidb: Compact Rocky database migrations

Specific changes include:

- Add 'disabled' column to 'cell_mappings' table (058)
- Add 'generation' column to 'consumers' table (059)
- Add 'rules' column to 'instance_group_policy' table (060)
- Add 'queued_for_delete' column to 'instance_mappings' table (061)

Note that we need to explicitly disable constraints for 'Boolean' fields
sqlalchemy since these weren't added by sqlachemy-migrate.

Change-Id: Id1c970c3d52c7cc672d00cb0486bfe49d69531b7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set external_ids:ovn-chassis-mac-mappings

For distributed vlan in ovn we need to add support of
creating mac addresses per compute and seting them in
external_ids:ovn-chassis-mac-mappings.

Related-Bug: #1881593
Co-Authored-By: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iddca7d8942bc52127525847f129eac8ea03934a1

commit_message:
Reduce Heat engine workers

It conforms with API_WORKERS default calculation to avoid too much
processes consuming the memory.

Change-Id: If2b483711668715047662a286cb0f0e3b52bbdac
Signed-off-by: Cédric Ollivier <ollivier.cedric@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a3be28bed790f2603dc59f8ad0d179183605d7ba)

commit_message:
Reduce Heat engine workers

It conforms with API_WORKERS default calculation to avoid too much
processes consuming the memory.

Change-Id: If2b483711668715047662a286cb0f0e3b52bbdac
Signed-off-by: Cédric Ollivier <ollivier.cedric@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit a3be28bed790f2603dc59f8ad0d179183605d7ba)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-10 17:51:56.000000000', 'message': 'Use configured upper-constraints for non-master Tempest run

If any job use older Tempest version then we can not need
to use the master upper-constraints as they can be
incompatible most of the time. We need to use the compatible
constraints of what version of Tempest is configured to run.

Below devstack patch adding the new way to configure
the upper-constraints via new variable TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS
when Tempest master is not used.
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/774711

We need to use the same variable to use the configured constraints
in run-tempest roles also so that when run-tempest recreate the
tempest venv then it honor the same configured constraints instead
if using master and error For example:
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/854450dc514041a78fd250dde0eb138e/log/job-output.txt#31341

Change-Id: I32d539b02366c8ae7ea70195674a97ed6a8ae759
'}, {'created': '2021-02-10 17:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'Use configured upper-constraints for non-master Tempest run

commit_message:
Use configured upper-constraints for non-master Tempest run

If any job use older Tempest version then we can not need
to use the master upper-constraints as they can be
incompatible most of the time. We need to use the compatible
constraints of what version of Tempest is configured to run.

Below devstack patch adding the new way to configure
the upper-constraints via new variable TEMPEST_VENV_UPPER_CONSTRAINTS
when Tempest master is not used.
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/774711

We need to use the same variable to use the configured constraints
in run-tempest roles also so that when run-tempest recreate the
tempest venv then it honor the same configured constraints instead
if using master and error For example:
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/854450dc514041a78fd250dde0eb138e/log/job-output.txt#31341

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/774716

Change-Id: I32d539b02366c8ae7ea70195674a97ed6a8ae759

commit_message:
Explicitly use python3 for python scripts

Focal images do not provide 'python' anymore,
and this  means that those scripts are broken
in that environment without this change.

And make sure the scripts are really py3 compatible
(fix a buffering issue)

Change-Id: I652e5d007d5a606f0fe89ac6b3ea76f765be1ae4

ifxi python

select line buffering for text file

Change-Id: If8657f4f824f091783b2ae35496e731da0c014c0

commit_message:
Negative test for web-download import

This adds a negative test for the web-download image import method,
which provides a URL that could not possibly work (hopefully). This
tests that we handle the situation properly and report that store as
failed in the API.

Related-Bug: #1914826
Change-Id: Id559f1fc1428c5e4bc17171c3ea3542aafc6e001

commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: Ic99f1f872e47135b6c4f4c807f61d9b1db047b42

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-01 17:55:33.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b
(cherry picked from commit 11838a2bc50caa40e776bce211f5f2d1d16a14af)

commit_message:
Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b
(cherry picked from commit 11838a2bc50caa40e776bce211f5f2d1d16a14af)

[{'created': '2020-07-12 03:11:51.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ia48fbcdb7787e177fb877984edc1a2a053f75b90
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: Ia48fbcdb7787e177fb877984edc1a2a053f75b90

commit_message:
Add .gitreview defaultbranch to fix issue with duplicate tags

As described in related bug the last three tags 13.0.0 wallaby
12.0.0 victoria and 11.0.2 Ussuri were pointing to the same commit.
This creates a new commit so we can tag that instead.

Updates test-requirements to fix issue seen at [1] and then fixes
pep8 issues seen after that.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/3b0b61736bf94ec9bea0e25ba72b709f
Related-Bug: 1918311

Change-Id: I2a8af7edff3bdc16053e04734672bdc429872568

commit_message:
Add .gitreview defaultbranch to fix issue with duplicate tags

As described in related bug the last three tags 13.0.0 wallaby
12.0.0 victoria and 11.0.2 Ussuri were pointing to the same commit.
This creates a new commit so we can tag that instead.

Updates test-requirements to fix issue seen at [1] and then fixes
pep8 issues seen after that.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/62e1246f40e0419bafd69a0dad8669e1
Related-Bug: 1918311

Change-Id: I7b82d4a55281c1532fde3de4ee7b25fbecb29c85

Add .gitreview defaultbranch to fix issue with duplicate tags

As described in related bug the last three tags 13.0.0 wallaby
12.0.0 victoria and 11.0.2 Ussuri were pointing to the same commit.
This creates a new commit so we can tag that instead.

Updates test-requirements to fix issue seen at [1] and then fixes
pep8 issues seen after that.

subject: Part 4 - Add RBAC protection tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 23:42:57.000000000', 'message': 'Part 4 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- share instances (GET, POST)
- share instance export locations (GET)
- share network (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share network subnets (GET, POST, DELETE)
- share replica export locations (GET)

Change-Id: I99916c7edaa1e8d0cf245fdb3103e915f573cd40
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Part 4 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- share instances (GET, POST)
- share instance export locations (GET)
- share network (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share network subnets (GET, POST, DELETE)
- share replica export locations (GET)

Change-Id: I99916c7edaa1e8d0cf245fdb3103e915f573cd40
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: Add edge branch for openstack-helm
messages:
[{'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-03-09 21:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2021-03-09 21:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2021-03-09 21:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30449, 'date': '2021-03-10 03:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-10 10:08:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hello,

Openstack isn't managed by coordinated releases [1][2].

I think we can't proceed like this without governance discussion first. Then governance should be updated accordingly to the outcomes of the discussion.

https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/reference/projects.yaml#L1936
https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/release-management.html#deliverables-handled-by-the-release-management-team"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:57:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, we should probably create the feature branch manually, since OpenStack-Helm is not managed through this repository. Let's discuss it at today's meeting."}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-03-11 14:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not needed'}]

commit_message:
Add edge branch for openstack-helm

This change adds the "edge" feature branch for openstack-helm
in order to implement a more edge cloud compatible feature.

Change-Id: I83af9f8fe120c632f54a0af72ba88f439a5a23a9

Fix create_vm_for_connectivity_test

With the recent change on tempest[1] making the
_create_security_group method non-private, we should
adjust our tests to do the same.

commit_message:
Add new policy rule SG_OWNER

During the migration to new, secure-rbac policies we already proposed
rules NET_OWNER and PARENT_OWNER to extract "ADMIN" from the old,
deprecated rules.
We missed to do the same for SG_OWNER so this patch adds it and also
switch new SG rules to use that new rule instead of old one.

Change-Id: Ic3ddfbfd0df59ffd10576f02730202c8b740ed26

commit_message:
Change dashes to underscore in setup.cfg

Recent versions of setuptools are warning that usage of dash-separated
keys will not be supported in future versions.

Change-Id: I40e09327f4d3d9db183aaea8eaedc52e1d5e9233

commit_message:
Add code comments on why content-provider check

Add code comments on why content-provider check
can fail.  The context was not clear to me, so
a little code comment may help others.

Related-Bug: #1918320
Change-Id: I9ba4c22544f0ddd1efb4a798d75ac133bfbb846d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-16 13:10:36.000000000', 'message': "Use Fedora 31 for tests

Aso configures swap as before

https://review.opendev.org/750941 changed the default
swap to 1024MB for jobs and this seems to resulting in
high failure rate of the functional and grenade jobs.

Let's configure it back to what used to before i.e 8192MB.

Change-Id: Ia45e957bb24f5596a5ef16271f71ba8b77df9e42
(cherry picked from commit f18a6767927965b930579995eb0b3d13c647bc26
and cherry picked from commit f419923a0d3aa62485296ab7666485e74af57c8e)
(cherry picked from commit cb2ff87cd7c87d893cea1f296bb22d0c14ee64ac)
"}]
commit_message:
Use Fedora 31 for tests

Aso configures swap as before

https://review.opendev.org/750941 changed the default
swap to 1024MB for jobs and this seems to resulting in
high failure rate of the functional and grenade jobs.

Let's configure it back to what used to before i.e 8192MB.

Change-Id: Ia45e957bb24f5596a5ef16271f71ba8b77df9e42
(cherry picked from commit f18a6767927965b930579995eb0b3d13c647bc26
and cherry picked from commit f419923a0d3aa62485296ab7666485e74af57c8e)
(cherry picked from commit cb2ff87cd7c87d893cea1f296bb22d0c14ee64ac)

commit_message:
Add tripleo_unbound role

This patch adds a TripleO Ansible role that configures the Unbound DNS
resolver.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/779048

Change-Id: I87d21e03974965bf742a46364cae02457481e793

commit_message:
Reject HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING trait in named groups

The patch 278ab01c32 added support for specifying cpu_thread_policy as a
trait in the flavor extra_spec. The original regexp supported numbered
request groups. Nova now support named request groups [1]. However
after discussing this in the review we think this trait only be
provided in the unnamed group.

So this patch adds an extra_spec validator that rejects
HW_CPU_HYPERTHREADING in a named group. Existing flavors with such
config is usable but the trait in the named group is ignored.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1490a54fa92ece6d9fd676d8e4a7498460714f92/nova/api/validation/extra_specs/traits.py#L39

Change-Id: I275fada367e60f360aca4d1e1b6d3b8dc535865c
Closes-Bug: #1883682

commit_message:
Create ovb 2.0 release and cut stable/2.0 branch

Last tag was created more than 2 years ago since
then master have included couple of features and
bug fixes. It would be good to get a tag release
for current master and also a stable/2.0 to backport
fixes into it.

Add stable-branch-type: upstream to allow
naming scheme apart from openstack release names.

Also add seperate release type for openstack-virtual-baremetal
as it's not publishing other pypi or tarball artifacts.

Change-Id: Ia8c9c5e8ad577f6ec1796591e77fddaffa62f008

[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-05 10:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-05 10:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-05 10:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-08-09 07:39:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

nice and this can always be used as a reference for 'how do i add molecule tests to my project'"}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-08-09 10:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-14 09:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-08-15 09:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

So, this is a mostly python repository, adding molecule here means we could test easily the same python script on various platform using molecule and containers, but I would like to see a broader discussion on ignoring nodepool capabilities and create another provisioning layer on top of the existing nodes whose handling is left entirely to the developer.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-26 20:57:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

i'm unclear about the intent here. do we plan to write functional tests for tripleo-repos that are executed by molecule?

I know molecule is used for our ansible content, but given this is a python repo, I don't understand how it will be used."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-27 09:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

James, molecule can be used to quickly test cross-platform compatibility of any code by leveraging containers, without testing any Ansible roles. Mainly we can use molecule to run the python code on 5 platforms, see that it does the job.

The most important benefit of using molecule for doing this is that it allows a developer to test changes locally. The classic testing with platform-specific zuul jobs does not allow local testing, at all.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-27 12:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> James, molecule can be used to quickly test cross-platform
 > compatibility of any code by leveraging containers, without testing
 > any Ansible roles. Mainly we can use molecule to run the python
 > code on 5 platforms, see that it does the job.
 > 
 > The most important benefit of using molecule for doing this is that
 > it allows a developer to test changes locally. The classic testing
 > with platform-specific zuul jobs does not allow local testing, at
 > all.

ok, understood.

Was there any wider discussion about this direction? apologies if it already happened, i was out for ~2 weeks. i just want to make sure that we are staying aligned with the broader OpenStack community, and that the rest of TripleO is also aware of this direction.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-27 21:26:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

I don't believe we should be adding molecule jobs to non-ansible projects."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-09-03 14:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

closing as discussed on Sep 3rd.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-12-17 10:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-12-17 10:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-03-11 13:12:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 13:11:29.000000000', 'message': "compute: Add support for loading BDMs from files

The syntax of the '--block-device' parameter is complex and easily
screwed up. Allow users to load a block device config from a file. For
example:

  $ openstack server create ... --block-device file:///tmp/bdm.json ...

This should alleviate the pain that is BDMv2 somewhat.

No functional tests are provided since we already have tests for the CSV
style of passing parameters and the unit tests show that the net result
is the same.

Change-Id: I3e3299bbdbbb343863b4c14fb4d9196ff3e1698d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
compute: Add support for loading BDMs from files

The syntax of the '--block-device' parameter is complex and easily
screwed up. Allow users to load a block device config from a file. For
example:

  $ openstack server create ... --block-device file:///tmp/bdm.json ...

This should alleviate the pain that is BDMv2 somewhat.

No functional tests are provided since we already have tests for the CSV
style of passing parameters and the unit tests show that the net result
is the same.

Change-Id: I3e3299bbdbbb343863b4c14fb4d9196ff3e1698d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2021-03-05 12:05:02.000000000', 'message': "compute: Add functional tests for --block-device

This mostly reuses the existing tests for '--block-device-mapping',
which can hopefully be removed at some point in the future.

This highlights two issues with the implementation of this option.
Firstly, the 'boot_index' parameter is not required so don't mandate it.
Secondly, and more significantly, we were defaulting the destination
type for the 'image' source type to 'local'. Nova only allows you to
attach a single image to local mapping [1], which means this default
would only make sense if you were expecting users to use the
'--block-device' option exclusively and omit the '--image' option. This
is the *less common* case so this is a bad default. Default instead to a
destination type of 'volume' like everything else, and require users
specifying '--block-device' alone to pass 'destination_type=local'
explicitly.

Change-Id: I1718be965f57c3bbdb8a14f3cfac967dd4c55b4d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
compute: Add functional tests for --block-device

This mostly reuses the existing tests for '--block-device-mapping',
which can hopefully be removed at some point in the future.

This highlights two issues with the implementation of this option.
Firstly, the 'boot_index' parameter is not required so don't mandate it.
Secondly, and more significantly, we were defaulting the destination
type for the 'image' source type to 'local'. Nova only allows you to
attach a single image to local mapping [1], which means this default
would only make sense if you were expecting users to use the
'--block-device' option exclusively and omit the '--image' option. This
is the *less common* case so this is a bad default. Default instead to a
destination type of 'volume' like everything else, and require users
specifying '--block-device' alone to pass 'destination_type=local'
explicitly.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c8a6f8d2e/nova/block_device.py#L193-L206

Change-Id: I1718be965f57c3bbdb8a14f3cfac967dd4c55b4d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

check arm64'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-03-04 18:50:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

Marking -1 to ask a question.
This appears to be failing and not zuul -1.
Are you proposing merging this as-is to work on this, or should we get this passing first?
Why is zuul +1 even though the job fails and it's not non-voting?"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-03-06 09:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

check arm64

> Are you proposing merging this as-is to work on this, or should we get this passing first?

I got the job passing CI twice long time ago. Local testing seemed to consistently pass deployment and smoke testing. The main issue I observed last time was ARM64 nodepool nodes were not stable and a regression in CentOS 8 (https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1862714). The later issue might have been fixed meanwhile.

So, I would like to get https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/+/747629 and this patch merged if possible. Other community members also seem to be interested in ARM64-based Octavia deployments -- see https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/octavia/+/770937.

> Why is zuul +1 even though the job fails and it's not non-voting?

ARM64 CI jobs enter a dedicated "check-arm64" CI pipeline. All jobs in that pipeline are non-voting. commit_message:
Add non-voting aarch64 scenario job

The Linux kernel does not support nested virtualization for ARM yet, so
libvirt runs VMs on QEMU-TCG which make our tests run very slow.

This job runs a smoke scenario test on a CentOS 8 aarch64 devstack
environment. Tests are limited to those marked as smoke because
otherwise the job would take a considerable amount of time to run.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738096
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/779943

Change-Id: I4dba477053cc71c54b9494c8f6dc6cd4b97687aa

commit_message:
Upgrade mariadb storage during upgrade tasks

When a tripleo major upgrade or FFU causes an update or mariadb
to a new major version (e.g. 10.1 -> 10.3), some internal DB
tables must be upgraded (myisam tables), and sometimes some
the existing user tables may be migrated to new mariadb defaults.

Move the db-specific upgrade steps into a dedicated script and
make sure that it is called at the right time while upgrading
the undercloud and/or the overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1913438

Change-Id: I92353622994b28c895d95bdcbe348a73b6c6bb99
(cherry picked from commit ad3516951017d742aabd2771f69ffdfd9554196c)

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for ACLs API

This patch adds the new RBAC rules for secure RBAC to the ACL API.  The
existing RBAC rules are not changed and should continue to work as
expected.

Change-Id: I175a4aa7e41b6ac88d1509dd85e0cb96ea6ee411

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 15:24:26.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-octaviaclient for Wallaby

This proposed a release for python-octaviaclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Monday, March 11.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.2.0..6dffa41
dfcdd57 Improve error messages in list/show calls
80a5331 Remove install unnecessary packages
21f1d67 Add ALPN support for pools
381c2fc Fix lower-constraints job
ca9146b remove unicode from code
9c4b85a Add tag support for Octavia resources
f832587 Add support for PROXYV2 protocol
1a133a3 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
1d34fcc Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I145846fb5c4dbd33c3f28700bee9d8f05f7296f2

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: Ibf3f1c2670288aa00469126d2ce74ac00954094a

[{'created': '2021-03-10 13:16:51.000000000', 'message': "Check if no members in pool better in batch update

member_batch_update() might find a loadbalancer with
a pool that contains no members, but calling split(',')
will result in an existing member list of ['']. Force
it to an empty list if there are no members.

Closes-Bug: #1912779
Change-Id: Iec46c3e1ebef822d43964e13962153dc8760ee42
(cherry picked from commit 6e30b8552ca83e0424ec460a4b4728cd70505c7a)
"}]
commit_message:
Check if no members in pool better in batch update

member_batch_update() might find a loadbalancer with
a pool that contains no members, but calling split(',')
will result in an existing member list of ['']. Force
it to an empty list if there are no members.

Closes-Bug: #1912779
Change-Id: Iec46c3e1ebef822d43964e13962153dc8760ee42
(cherry picked from commit 6e30b8552ca83e0424ec460a4b4728cd70505c7a)

I'm a bit torn on this one... I'd rather keep all monasca pieces under the same model but it seems there are pieces that are independent already. Waiting for input from the PTL."}, {'account_id': 28062, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi, we would like to keep this repository in the cycle-with-intermediary because of plans to build Docker containers in sync with the cycles like in most of other Monasca modules.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agreed'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for your reply, then I abandon this patch'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The project team want to keep this project under the coordinated series'}]

Project did not have any change merged over the cycle, maybe it is time
to transition it independent.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
transition and we will process right away. If the team doesn't agree,
leave a -1 with some detail on the status, then we will cut the Wallaby
stable branch for this project.

Change-Id: Ia4f7bbbac86d02bf68c6295a868a4ad10236ba4e
"}]
commit_message:
Propose to move monasca-statsd to independent

Project did not have any change merged over the cycle, maybe it is time
to transition it independent.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
transition and we will process right away. If the team doesn't agree,
leave a -1 with some detail on the status, then we will cut the Wallaby
stable branch for this project.

Change-Id: Ia4f7bbbac86d02bf68c6295a868a4ad10236ba4e

commit_message:
Add aarch64/amd64 support to amphora and devstack

The disk image create tool can now build aarch64/arm64 amphora images.
The devstack plugin will facilitate image builds and upload to Glance
for this CPU architecture.

Change-Id: I1cebd8a3da58dc56ebbfac22f7802ab7f52585e1

I was a bit hesitant due to the amount of lower-constraint upgrades, especially as some bumps are quite a big change (e.g. +3 major version bump), but as far as I see most of them are valid bumps, e.g. ussuri version of cinder libraries, etc.

Anyway, validator passed, PTL approved the release patch and I don't see any issue in list-changes-results.log. Still, giving only +1 as I am not that confident with this. o:)"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Cinder team releases for stable/ussuri

Updates:
- cinder 16.3.0 : minor version update because of requirement bump
- cinderlib 2.1.0 : minor version update because of requirement bump
- os-brick 3.0.5 : requirement bump but 3.1.0 is taken by victoria
- python-cinderclient 7.0.2 : requirement bump but 7.1.0 is taken by victoria
- python-brick-cinderclient-ext 1.0.2 : requirement bump but 1.1.0 is taken
by victoria

Change-Id: Iabaa074147dc38125e22dd8f3ecb8ea664bb3bd7

subject: Correctly configure S3 Token Middleware for Swift
messages: [{'account_id': 14200, 'date': '2021-03-10 21:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2021-03-11 01:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30568, 'date': '2021-03-11 07:55:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16198, 'date': '2021-03-11 08:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:05:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 21:41:12.000000000', 'message': "Correctly configure S3 Token Middleware for Swift

According the documentation [1] there need to configure auth_uri in the
[filter:s3token] section instead of www_authenticate_uri which cause an
error 'swift.common.wsgi.ConfigFileError: Invalid auth_uri; must
include scheme and host' during start the swift-proxy-server container.

1. https://docs.openstack.org/swift/ussuri/middleware.html#s3-token-middleware

Change-Id: I6b8f5807ebb746428a501dca13eae30763dede8d
Closes-Bug: 1862765
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 835920782fb48c4a750814fedd04126424334856)
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly configure S3 Token Middleware for Swift

According the documentation [1] there need to configure auth_uri in the
[filter:s3token] section instead of www_authenticate_uri which cause an
error 'swift.common.wsgi.ConfigFileError: Invalid auth_uri; must
include scheme and host' during start the swift-proxy-server container.

1. https://docs.openstack.org/swift/ussuri/middleware.html#s3-token-middleware

Change-Id: I6b8f5807ebb746428a501dca13eae30763dede8d
Closes-Bug: 1862765
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 835920782fb48c4a750814fedd04126424334856)

subject: ansible-lint: add unnamed-task to the skip list
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:30:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 09:12:17.000000000', 'message': 'ansible-lint: add unnamed-task to the skip list

The 5.0.3 release of ansible-lint makes the linters job fail, due to the
addition of an unnamed-task rule. We have quite a large number of
unnamed tasks, typically include_tasks or include_role. We may want to
address this at some point, but not right now.

Change-Id: I4ee706fe2463d62e4e16412117d4373748ea43e3
'}]
commit_message:
ansible-lint: add unnamed-task to the skip list

The 5.0.3 release of ansible-lint makes the linters job fail, due to the
addition of an unnamed-task rule. We have quite a large number of
unnamed tasks, typically include_tasks or include_role. We may want to
address this at some point, but not right now.

Change-Id: I4ee706fe2463d62e4e16412117d4373748ea43e3

commit_message:
Reduce number of logs and disable ara HTML report

- Remove /var/log/kolla link to omit uploading the same logs twice
- Remove ARA HTML report (usually takes around 120MB) - can be easily
  generated from the sqlite db

Change-Id: I74cd6d1128689ab2c73f00ee08af3778d7d670a4
(cherry picked from commit 191b46ef40b5e33cf1581a89e8ce7ab699df44d8)

In order to disable libvirt debug in CI (which takes vast amount of storage)

commit_message:
Introduce nova_libvirt_logging_debug

In order to disable libvirt debug in CI (which takes vast amount of storage)
this change introduces nova_libvirt_logging_debug and disables that in CI.

Change-Id: I90bfd1b300ad3202ea4d139fda6d6beb44c5820f
(cherry picked from commit eabdf1e9f959c274e827e8c24a6ea63709c1033c)

commit_message:
Fix Octavia OctaviaTenantLogFacility default

This patch corrects the Octavia setting OctaviaTenantLogFacility to
have the same default value as the project uses by changing it to 0.

Change-Id: I89056ad69def9d8f45907bac0fdc9af54bb28dff
(cherry picked from commit 699aa46642940192fc616ffed3ff8b931bbcc4bd)

subject: remove argsplat warning
messages:
[{'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-05 11:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-08 10:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-08 10:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The reason this task has been done like this is to allow the deployer to specify any of the valid module parameters for apt_key, even though the role defaults use file and id. This use case here is to point to internal mirrors which may be signed by an alternative key to the upstream one.

A better solution may be to pass all of the possible module parameters but with |default(omit) so that whichever ones are present in the potentially overridden variable are used.'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-10 22:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-03-11 08:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 11:18:54.000000000', 'message': 'remove argsplat warning

Change-Id: Ie83b708ac7ee094e5ab0a72099d83418cc4cb58a
'}, {'created': '2021-03-10 19:11:47.000000000', 'message': "remove argsplat warning

Since we can't be sure how deployers would override this setting,
we try applying all parameters, and omit those not defined.

Change-Id: Ie83b708ac7ee094e5ab0a72099d83418cc4cb58a
"}]
commit_message:
remove argsplat warning

Since we can't be sure how deployers would override this setting,
we try applying all parameters, and omit those not defined.

Change-Id: Ie83b708ac7ee094e5ab0a72099d83418cc4cb58a

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I8b78c7b640ab18ddfc809cb4603decc739d494d1

multinode and standalone/scenarios are already included via the
wired-up templates. Keeps only the undercloud-minion which is not
in the tripleo-multinode-container-minimal-pipeline [1]. Part of
wider tripleo-ci optimisation at [2].

commit_message:
Add missing consumer_job variable to Ussuri zuul layout

This was posted as part of the cherrypicks at [1]. However
unlike other branches Ussuri does not have a bunch of overrides.
Instead this just adds the missing consumer_job variables.

Part of wider tripleo-ci optimisation at [2].

[1] 7746b2e57f546a04231b490143085a1157b14c27
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I7c4ba85cbc1525079a94cb76aa9576b24f1d0fbb

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-02-25 16:40:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The final OVN issue is caused by https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/commit/7fb5312be3190306eaebf92b30c339c486c074cd. Without this constraint, tox pulls in virtualenv > 20.4.0 which causes pip >= 20.1.0 to be the default. In this state pip can't be downgraded."}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-02-26 09:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-02-26 14:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-11 08:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is fixed now by refactoring away from the previous functional tests'}]

commit_message:
Combined patch to unblock CI

Move neutron pip packages from constraints to requirements
Squashed with moving functional jobs to focal

OpenDaylight packages are not available for Focal so those
jobs are moved to non-voting.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777091
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777730
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/777753
Change-Id: I5484988ba12fb3b89ea15057374eb723993617fb

commit_message:
Fix versioned schema validation

Makes API microversion bounds respected on the schema validator.
Adds extra tests that check this.

This fixes the new 'enabled' flag for which we used the bounds.
No need to backport currently. No impact on stable.

Change-Id: I57f83cebdc02eee892d6269836566b6d07c609f9

subject: Replace md5 with oslo version
messages:
[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2021-02-25 21:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-03-03 16:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 30742, 'date': '2021-03-04 08:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks Ade! This change seems significant since md5 being a non-approved algorithm and it was still being used in tempest. Hence, there was a need for such replacement.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-03-04 18:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM, as these tests are non-security context by default, nothing changes, hashlib.md5() will be called anyway however the change allows to run the tests on machines with FIPS enabled.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-03-10 22:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-25 21:14:28.000000000', 'message': 'Replace md5 with oslo version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() has been added to
oslo_utils.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

In this case, all hashlib.md5() invocations are to run tempest tests
so this is not a security context.  With this patch, we can run tempest
tests from a FIPS enabled machine.

Change-Id: Ib301466bb0a1996997c63599918fa96059a927bd
'}]
commit_message:
Replace md5 with oslo version

md5 is not an approved algorithm in FIPS mode, and trying to
instantiate a hashlib.md5() will fail when the system is running in
FIPS mode.

md5 is allowed when in a non-security context.  There is a plan to
add a keyword parameter (usedforsecurity) to hashlib.md5() to annotate
whether or not the instance is being used in a security context.

In the case where it is not, the instantiation of md5 will be allowed.
See https://bugs.python.org/issue9216 for more details.

Some downstream python versions already support this parameter.  To
support these versions, a new encapsulation of md5() has been added to
oslo_utils.  See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750031/

This patch is to replace the instances of hashlib.md5() with this new
encapsulation, adding an annotation indicating whether the usage is
a security context or not.

In this case, all hashlib.md5() invocations are to run tempest tests
so this is not a security context.  With this patch, we can run tempest
tests from a FIPS enabled machine.

Change-Id: Ib301466bb0a1996997c63599918fa96059a927bd

commit_message:
Make nova-ceph-multistore use policy.yaml

This changes our tweak of glance policy to use the new yaml format
instead of json. Glance needs to tweak this file too in some jobs,
and it's easier to do that in two places if the more modern yaml
format is used.

Change-Id: I4d4263987719d4885f114931130a71877f25d21e
Related-Bug: #1916926

Without this "make",It can lead to not being found <helm-toolkit> when running this script.

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Resolve warning

setuptools is now emitting the following warning when building nova:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'python-requires' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'python_requires' instead

Do as it says. While we're here, we update a few other options to use
their new variants and add some additional metadata. This leaves one
final warning:

  Warning: Unknown distribution option: 'requires_python'

That unfortunately cannot be fixed here and requires a separate fix in
pbr.

Change-Id: I859bc89bc1ee80652f471c3463ef6562d720263b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support bytes type in generate_public_ID()

python-ldap3.0 or later running on python3 uses str or bytes
data type according to what fields are returned.
local_id may be a bytes data type.
To handle it properly, mapping[key] needs to be examined for
identifying its data type and what python version is used.

Closes-Bug: #1901654
Change-Id: Iac097235fd31e166028c169d14ec0937c663c21c
(cherry picked from commit f7df9fba828328d8b20e85d711c1d27c77089632)
(cherry picked from commit 5b860e0b3b4e318b91325996156bae3f99abd6c7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-27 20:10:39.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Allow egress ICMPv6 only for know addresses

Before that patch it was possible to send ICMPv6 packets like e.g.
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_MLD_QUERY,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_RS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NA

And that could cause some security issues as instance could advertise
that it owns IPv6 address which really don't belong to it.

Now rules in table=71 which allows that traffic are "per mac/ipaddress"
and are allowed only for fixed ips allocated to port and port's
allowed_address_pairs.

Closes-Bug: #1902917
Change-Id: I4749fdc6a6cabd253b971bf4010ff76f5593c59c
(cherry picked from commit 4b5bcff64c4725b37f094dfd2613ec58f723d304)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Allow egress ICMPv6 only for know addresses

Before that patch it was possible to send ICMPv6 packets like e.g.
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_MLD_QUERY,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_RS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NS,
    neutron_lib.constants.ICMPV6_TYPE_NA

And that could cause some security issues as instance could advertise
that it owns IPv6 address which really don't belong to it.

Now rules in table=71 which allows that traffic are "per mac/ipaddress"
and are allowed only for fixed ips allocated to port and port's
allowed_address_pairs.

Closes-Bug: #1902917
Change-Id: I4749fdc6a6cabd253b971bf4010ff76f5593c59c
(cherry picked from commit 4b5bcff64c4725b37f094dfd2613ec58f723d304)

commit_message:
Delete system role assignments from system_assignment table

This patch ensures to delete the system role assignments from
all the assignment tables in keystone after deleting the role
user has over the system.

This also make sure of deleting stale role assignments before
deleting role for the deployments that are already in this state.

Closes-Bug: #1878938

Change-Id: I4df19c45c870ff3fb78578ca1fb7dd0d35da3c82
(cherry picked from commit c1dcbb05b4488f1fa3e7af4d9171d11702d94119)
(cherry picked from commit b83170a386ba8da2195c7494d04d832ce9b6d7b0)
(cherry picked from commit 6f93063ff95f3c65af106a09281427e411d01850)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 09:56:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix removal of dvr-src mac flows when non-gateway port on router is deleted

Removal of non-gateway port on DVR router deletes all the DVR to
SRC mac flows for the instances of same subnet on that compute node.
The instances are not reachable from any other network.

This patch checks if the DVR router port is gateway for the subnet
or not. And deletes the DVR-SRC mac flows only if it is gateway port.
The DVR-SRC mac flows are deleted if the gateway is not set for the subnet.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_dvr_neutron_agent.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py

arp_responder_enabled check added for the ARP flow rule.
The unit test case have arp_responder false by default, so adjusted
the br_int mock calls accordingly.

Change-Id: Iadc1671c862f8c01e5761e92b82a04849d4bb411
Closes-Bug: #1892405
(cherry picked from commit 329ea19f8b881421b9b5ae2fcc855f96af72a9f5)
(cherry picked from commit bf8fc2db0ca74631b60475103a4d3f543d052203)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix removal of dvr-src mac flows when non-gateway port on router is deleted

Removal of non-gateway port on DVR router deletes all the DVR to
SRC mac flows for the instances of same subnet on that compute node.
The instances are not reachable from any other network.

This patch checks if the DVR router port is gateway for the subnet
or not. And deletes the DVR-SRC mac flows only if it is gateway port.
The DVR-SRC mac flows are deleted if the gateway is not set for the subnet.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_dvr_neutron_agent.py
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py

arp_responder_enabled check added for the ARP flow rule.
The unit test case have arp_responder false by default, so adjusted
the br_int mock calls accordingly.

Change-Id: Iadc1671c862f8c01e5761e92b82a04849d4bb411
Closes-Bug: #1892405
(cherry picked from commit 329ea19f8b881421b9b5ae2fcc855f96af72a9f5)
(cherry picked from commit bf8fc2db0ca74631b60475103a4d3f543d052203)

commit_message:
libvirt: Deprecate disable_native_luksv1 and rbd_volume_local_attach

As noted at the time these workarounds are no longer required given the
underlying performance regressions have been resolved in libgcrypt.

Change-Id: Ibb718003ba614738eabbc797da3d0203eac5468c

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for the floating ip port forwarding API

This commit updates the floating ip port forwarding policies to understand
scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader
series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and
improve security.

Change-Id: Ie5720d534425fc364ee39e26b13e75bc59b9afa5

commit_message:
Set 'DEBUG' to horizon::log_level if HorizonDebug or Debug is true

Previously, if HorzionDebug of Debug was true, horizon::django_debug
was set to True. However, those parameters didn't change the logger
level of horizon components. By this change, when HorizonDebug or
Debug is True, horizon::log_level is set to 'DEBUG'.

Change-Id: I0a140682c552ba8a4e943124330852259e66142d
(cherry picked from commit 812aa726ef897e624f49edac88171d1645fec072)

commit_message:
Add delegate_fact_hosts: false on ci scenarios

This change adds delegate_facts_hosts: false to the
existing ceph-ansible scenarios.
This was introduced due to the --limit option to avoid
gathering facts, but since we're running on standalone
and the same node is present in all groups, having that
variable set to True (which is the ceph-ansible default)
makes no sense.

Change-Id: I44433731f73882f62591e8067743beec4d423ef7
(cherry picked from commit c0e8697550bba624bd935d5ad01135a1d10094e9)

commit_message:
Add delegate_fact_hosts: false on ci scenarios

This change adds delegate_facts_hosts: false to the
existing ceph-ansible scenarios.
This was introduced due to the --limit option to avoid
gathering facts, but since we're running on standalone
and the same node is present in all groups, having that
variable set to True (which is the ceph-ansible default)
makes no sense.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/779315
Change-Id: I44433731f73882f62591e8067743beec4d423ef7
(cherry picked from commit c0e8697550bba624bd935d5ad01135a1d10094e9)

[{'created': '2021-03-05 21:04:20.000000000', 'message': 'Adds net_cidr_map variable to allow cidr lists

This patch exposes the net_cidr_map variable so that tasks can
access the list of CIDRs that are valid for a network as opposed
to attempting to build the CIDRs from the network definitions.

In spine-leaf or edge use cases the networks may have multiple
subnets assigned to a given network.

The new Unbound service will use these maps to build lists of
CIDRs allowed to make queries.

Change-Id: I6004519e8b2317d19356c4a2b8bea416b4d94c22
'}]
commit_message:
Adds net_cidr_map variable to allow cidr lists

This patch exposes the net_cidr_map variable so that tasks can
access the list of CIDRs that are valid for a network as opposed
to attempting to build the CIDRs from the network definitions.

In spine-leaf or edge use cases the networks may have multiple
subnets assigned to a given network.

The new Unbound service will use these maps to build lists of
CIDRs allowed to make queries.

Change-Id: I6004519e8b2317d19356c4a2b8bea416b4d94c22

commit_message:
Update default overrides for openstack and ubuntu

By default when deploying the openstack AIO, it will deploy
openstack ocata release on ubuntu xenial, which by now is quite
old and largely unsupported. This change updates these default
overrides to train and bionic respectively in order to bring
the default settings to more recent/supported releases.

Change-Id: I9b6e1120101767356413b1341828dc8d39bc9b3c

Change-Id: I4f1fab9a7f5681824a0dc8f25d1a16cde5cad0cc

commit_message:
Add create ref acl for osh release groups

This change adds the create references to the acls for openstack-helm
and openstack-helm-infra. The permission for this will be set to the
subset openstack-helm-release and openstack-helm-infra-release groups
respectively.

Change-Id: I4f1fab9a7f5681824a0dc8f25d1a16cde5cad0cc

commit_message:
Implement new policy rules NET_OWNER and PARENT_OWNER

In commit [1] new policy rules NET_OWNER and PARENT_OWNER were
introduced but I forgot define what those rules actually means.
Now definition of those rules is actually added.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/778391

Change-Id: Ie0d30a444720c8a0fec261a153898b19aab4ee62

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I26f4c8fcaaaf0eca5e5d6fcb6fd443b56ea41f35

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for the port API

This commit updates the port policies to understand scope checking and account
for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of changes across
OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve security.

Change-Id: Iaa1d1024a5a9f1883ef3c8b073c685f17a099a6b
