messages:
[{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-01-22 12:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-01-22 13:53:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I'm working on fixing the broken jobs in another change, hopefully by EOD."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-01-22 19:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-01-27 11:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Seems like before we do copy() we need to check if existing_members is not empty.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-02-22 17:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok, after some additional investigation, it seems here:
existing_members = external_ids[pool_key].split(',')
existing_members is [''] if there are no existing lb members, that's how split(',') is supposed to work [1].
Either we rework that logic and check if it's empty (I assume external_ids[pool_key] should have a content of "id,id,id" and never be in form "id,,id" - because we could always get an empty member in a list) or live with the current patch approach.
[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16645083/when-splitting-an-empty-string-in-python-why-does-split-return-an-empty-list

@Brian: any comments?'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-02-24 19:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-02 22:26:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm going to push an update this as a test, hopefully I got the unit test correct."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-02 22:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-02 22:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-03 14:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-03-04 12:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Brian, this time I got swamped with other duties... ;-)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-03-10 11:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks Michal, Brian'}]

commit_message:
Check if no members in pool better in batch update

member_batch_update() might find a loadbalancer with
a pool that contains no members, but calling split(',')
will result in an existing member list of ['']. Force
it to an empty list if there are no members.

Closes-Bug: #1912779
Change-Id: Iec46c3e1ebef822d43964e13962153dc8760ee42

Duplicating host NUMA information that's already available on the ComputeNode feels like something we should avoid if at all possible"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-19 18:33:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Spitballing. How about adding 'host_socket' and maybe 'host_cell' attributes to 'InstanceNUMACell'? The latter isn't really necessary, since we use 'id' for that right now, but it would let us decouple this in the future (it's a confusing design, IMO). That former would let us avoid passing host NUMA information through to the PCI manager.

This feels like that scene for Scrubs [1], where I've got what I wanted [2] and then realized I didn't want it...

[1] 
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova-specs/+/765551/3/specs/wallaby/approved/pci-socket-policy.rst#79"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-19 18:35:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> 
> Spitballing. How about adding 'host_socket' and maybe 'host_cell' attributes to 'InstanceNUMACell'? The latter isn't really necessary, since we use 'id' for that right now, but it would let us decouple this in the future (it's a confusing design, IMO). That former would let us avoid passing host NUMA information through to the PCI manager.
> 
> This feels like that scene for Scrubs [1], where I've got what I wanted [2] and then realized I didn't want it...
> 
> [1] 
> [2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova-specs/+/765551/3/specs/wallaby/approved/pci-socket-policy.rst#79

[1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z2Oc7Ny5rus

Got distracted watching Scrubs highlights..."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-02-21 14:16:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

> Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> Code looks fine, but I need to revisit this once I'm sure it's truly necessary. Duplicating host NUMA information that's already available on the ComputeNode feels like something we should avoid if at all possible

I agree it's not great - but I found the alternative more confusing. I initially tried to do this by passing the host NUMA topology down through the PCI code's _filter_*() methods and it became... messy. None of them actually need it except for the new _filter_pools_for_socket_affinity() method that I add in the subsequent patch, and it just became a mess of 'host_cells=None' kwargs all over the place. Since the host NUMA topology isn't expect to change, I figured it's cleaner to just have it in the object, and use self.numa_topology in the only place we actually need it."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2021-02-21 14:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-02-21 14:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-04 19:25:55.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Track host NUMA topology in PCI manager

For the upcoming `socket` affinity, the PCI code needs to know the
host's NUMA topology in order to calculate the socket affinity of PCI
devices. Start tracking this in PCI stats and manager.

We need to track the NUMA topology at the object (not the class)
level, so all the _filter_*() classmethods that - in a subsequent
patch - will either use self.numa_topology directly or call a method
that does, are moved to the object level. They were only ever called
via self anyways.

In addition, to fetch the host NUMA topology at __init__(), the PCI
code needs to always be passed the node_id. Make this argument
mandatory - it was only ever None in tests, anyways.

Change-Id: I1d270cc3e88a74097eefe3b887106222ae06fe1c

"}, {'created': '2021-03-04 16:42:17.000000000', 'message': "pci: track host NUMA topology in stats

For the upcoming `socket` affinity, PCI stats needs to know the
host's NUMA topology in order to calculate the socket affinity of PCI
devices (based on their 'numa_node'). In this patch, the PCI manager
starts fetching its compute node to obtain its NUMA topology, and
starts passing the NUMA topology to PCI stats.

We need to track the NUMA topology at the object (not the class) level,
so all the '_filter_*()' classmethods in PCI stats that - in a
subsequent patch - will either use 'self.numa_topology' directly or
call a method that does, are moved to the object level. They were only
ever called via self anyways.

Implements: blueprint pci-socket-affinity
Change-Id: I1d270cc3e88a74097eefe3b887106222ae06fe1c

For the upcoming `socket` affinity, PCI stats needs to know the
host's NUMA topology in order to calculate the socket affinity of PCI
devices (based on their 'numa_node'). In this patch, the PCI manager
starts using its compute_node parameter to give a NUMA topology to PCI
stats.

PCI stats needs to track the NUMA topology at the object (not the
class) level, so all the '_filter_*()' classmethods that, in a
subsequent patch, will either use 'self.numa_topology' directly or
call a method that does, are moved to the object level. They were only
ever called via self anyways.

Implements: blueprint pci-socket-affinity
Change-Id: I1d270cc3e88a74097eefe3b887106222ae06fe1c
"}]
commit_message:
pci: track host NUMA topology in stats

For the upcoming `socket` affinity, PCI stats needs to know the
host's NUMA topology in order to calculate the socket affinity of PCI
devices (based on their 'numa_node'). In this patch, the PCI manager
starts using its compute_node parameter to give a NUMA topology to PCI
stats.

PCI stats needs to track the NUMA topology at the object (not the
class) level, so all the '_filter_*()' classmethods that, in a
subsequent patch, will either use 'self.numa_topology' directly or
call a method that does, are moved to the object level. They were only
ever called via self anyways.

Implements: blueprint pci-socket-affinity
Change-Id: I1d270cc3e88a74097eefe3b887106222ae06fe1c

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I439535f0ac5df735bdf0caf538edad97e1b0ac8d

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

Replace assertTrue by assertIn to fix with the latest flake8 version.
Add six in the documentation requirements to fix the build.
Fix the conflict status with hacking.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I580da15fefd6ad352e69749b77cc4664aef84f9c

commit_message:
Do not build iso for ussuri ipa

Since ipa-builder is branchless its code is used directly from master to
test ipa in stable releases.
The iso has been fixed only recently, and since we need to use
ipa-builder version 2.2.0 in stable/ussuri to test, build and publish
the ipa ramdisk, we can't also build an iso in CI or the build job will
break.
As a result we do not buildi an iso for ussuri ironic-python-agent.

Change-Id: I4801e87f5b3c37f113bfc9578c8e2aaa4d4f32f0

commit_message:
Puts DISABLE_PIP_VERSION_CHECK on a separate line

Previously all tox env folders created by the rule
had "DISABLE_PIP_VERSION_CHECK=1" appended to their name.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ief5c335c5f1faf17ee977bf414309376b11bd561

When a tripleo major upgrade or FFU causes an update or mariadb
to a new major version (e.g. 10.1 -> 10.3), some internal DB
tables must be upgraded (myisam tables), and sometimes the
existing user tables may be migrated to new mariadb defaults.

Move the db-specific upgrade steps into a dedicated script and
make sure that it is called at the right time while upgrading
the undercloud and/or the overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1913438

Change-Id: I92353622994b28c895d95bdcbe348a73b6c6bb99
(cherry picked from commit 712cfcc71bb9061082154460a6e04a619055f0a0)

commit_message:
Upgrade mariadb storage during upgrade tasks

When a tripleo major upgrade or FFU causes an update or mariadb
to a new major version (e.g. 10.1 -> 10.3), some internal DB
tables must be upgraded (myisam tables), and sometimes the
existing user tables may be migrated to new mariadb defaults.

Move the db-specific upgrade steps into a dedicated script and
make sure that it is called at the right time while upgrading
the undercloud and/or the overcloud.

Closes-Bug: #1913438

Change-Id: I92353622994b28c895d95bdcbe348a73b6c6bb99
(cherry picked from commit 712cfcc71bb9061082154460a6e04a619055f0a0)
(cherry picked from commit 724d65804d5e22693c3a706959f3a46b328d4521)

[{'created': '2021-03-09 15:47:02.000000000', 'message': 'Populate full VLAN range in "parse_network_vlan_ranges"

The method "parse_network_vlan_ranges" parses the
"network_vlan_ranges" parameter that defines, for the VLAN type
driver, the available physical networks and the assigned VLAN
ID ranges.

If only the network name is passed without defining a VLAN ID range,
that means all valid VLAN IDs are allowed (1, 4094).

The returned variable should contain this range in this case.

Change-Id: I53726d64167ba38c233c2cfc095ff6462bcb664e
Closes-Bug: #1918274
'}, {'created': '2021-03-09 15:51:14.000000000', 'message': 'Populate full VLAN range in "parse_network_vlan_ranges"

"network_vlan_ranges" parameter that defines, for the VLAN type
driver, the available physical networks and the assigned VLAN
ID ranges.

If only the network name is passed without defining a VLAN ID range,
that means all valid VLAN IDs are allowed (1, 4094).

The returned variable should contain this range in this case.

Change-Id: I53726d64167ba38c233c2cfc095ff6462bcb664e
Closes-Bug: #1918274
'}]
commit_message:
Populate full VLAN range in "parse_network_vlan_ranges"

The method "parse_network_vlan_ranges" parses the
"network_vlan_ranges" parameter that defines, for the VLAN type
driver, the available physical networks and the assigned VLAN
ID ranges.

If only the network name is passed without defining a VLAN ID range,
that means all valid VLAN IDs are allowed (1, 4094).

The returned variable should contain this range in this case.

Change-Id: I53726d64167ba38c233c2cfc095ff6462bcb664e
Closes-Bug: #1918274

commit_message:
Add neutron plugin to octavia-dsvm-base job

With octavia_create_network_interface_device() being in
the neutron tree, we have to enable the neutron plugin
in more jobs to have it visible, else o-hm0 will not
get created and it will fail.

Moved the occurence in the ipv6-only job to the parent
definition as well.

Change-Id: I0d15dbae9034ab17de69d884e8f57df0d25d4338

commit_message:
ovn: Add neutron-cleanup

The service cleans up orphaned tap devices on node boot. This is good
for cases were node was fenced or hard rebooted. There is similar patch
for OVS deployments [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/81265737187f32eef2b654a901ed74818873eb88

Closes-bug: #1899799

Conflicts:
	deployment/ovn/ovn-controller-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Idec9e5ca0a8d3de7414938c7f280c06bcbd906c1
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 92b6f306246468ecd26bdb5339b75bc574a9e9a3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-04 16:42:17.000000000', 'message': "pci: always pass node_id to manager

To implement the `socket` PCI NUMA affinity policy, we'll need to
track the host NUMA topology in the PCI stats code. To achieve this,
PCI stats will need to know the compute node it's running on. Prepare
for this by always passing node_id to the PCI manager. It was
previously optional, but that looks to have been only to facilitate
testing, as that's the only place where it was not passed it.

Implements: blueprint pci-socket-affinity
Change-Id: Idc839312d1449e9327ee7e3793d53ed080a44d0c
"}, {'created': '2021-03-08 20:19:23.000000000', 'message': "pci manager: replace node_id parameter with compute_node

To implement the `socket` PCI NUMA affinity policy, we'll need to
track the host NUMA topology in the PCI stats code. To achieve this,
PCI stats will need to know the compute node it's running on. Prepare
for this by replacing the node_id parameter with compute_node. Node_id
was previously optional, but that looks to have been only to
facilitate testing, as that's the only place where it was not passed
it. We use compute_node (instead of just making node_id mandatory)
because it allows for an optimization later on wherein the PCI manager
does not need to pull the ComputeNode object from the database
needlessly.

Implements: blueprint pci-socket-affinity
Change-Id: Idc839312d1449e9327ee7e3793d53ed080a44d0c
"}]
commit_message:
pci manager: replace node_id parameter with compute_node

To implement the `socket` PCI NUMA affinity policy, we'll need to
track the host NUMA topology in the PCI stats code. To achieve this,
PCI stats will need to know the compute node it's running on. Prepare
for this by replacing the node_id parameter with compute_node. Node_id
was previously optional, but that looks to have been only to
facilitate testing, as that's the only place where it was not passed
it. We use compute_node (instead of just making node_id mandatory)
because it allows for an optimization later on wherein the PCI manager
does not need to pull the ComputeNode object from the database
needlessly.

Implements: blueprint pci-socket-affinity
Change-Id: Idc839312d1449e9327ee7e3793d53ed080a44d0c

  doesn't get 'builds' appended.  The tox change puts it

commit_message:
Updates to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3

* Update requirements.txt to pin charm-tools to 2.8.3
* Update tox.ini to change the build parameters.
* This upgrades from <2.7 which adds reproducible charms
* Bug was fixed that controlled the default output directory
  doesn't get 'builds' appended.  The tox change puts it
  back so that stable & master both build to the same
  directory.  This may be reviewed in the future.
* The cs:ubuntu charm used in the test has changed its behaviour
  regarding the workload status message.  The check in tests.yaml and in
  the zaza test have been relaxed so that the workload status message is
  not checked.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/521
Change-Id: I34f77b745e678e9e45e481a5179a9e23f31e51d4

commit_message:
Add nova::compute::provider class to manage custom provider yaml file

Nova supports to configure resource provider inventory and traits using
a standardized YAML file format starting victoria release [1]. This
change adds the nova::compute::provider class to configure the custom
provider yaml file via puppet-nova.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/managing-resource-providers.html

Change-Id: If12d7f5a8c331e051eb543f88187c31e676f3b62

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib309ab2df5648a7c9d6b36420b1b1cd063c88a49

Leave a comment with 'run-DellEMC SC CI' to trigger a recheck. For more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_SC_CI"}, {'account_id': 16721, 'date': '2021-02-19 05:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

It's good that this came up because we can take a deeper look at the role of the nvmeof connector and what exactly are we breaking with the new connector.

About breaking existing drivers, which drivers exactly does it break please?

About changing connect_volume API (especially the adding of the volume UUID), that is true, but it is done according to approved spec: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-specs/+/766730

We can definitely rename 'target_nqn' to 'nqn', the reason we decided to use 'target_nqn' is to disamiguate it from a host (initiator) nqn, which may also be a required param for the backend to allow nvmeof connections to the target.

About requiring 'volume_uuid', ('uuid' in the spec, can be renamed), the reason for this is that without an identifier for the volume, you will have concurrency / race condition issues when figuring out which new device was connected (made a comment on line 120 where this is happens)

With all that being said, of course breaking any existing drivers was never an intention (if we could get some pointers to which specific drivers were broken, maybe we could even help update them to use the new nvmeof connector?)

I am dedicated to resolving any regressions this is causing, and if we can't settle on a single implementation for the time being, I would like to propose the following:

Keep the same old implementation in the connector for when the same old connection info is passed to it. And, only when it sees 'volume_replicas' as a param, then it will use the new logic/features we implemented. Does this sound reasonable?"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2021-02-19 16:44:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Zohar, thanks for the quick response.

As discussed today during the festival of reviews:
- I filed a bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1916264
- we agreed roll-back the changes to the original connector to restore API and create a new connector with new API to support MDRAID replication
- it seems that spec should be updated to correspond the fix
- while CI doesn't report to gerrit, I'll test changes manually and try to push CI to test once patch will be proposed to gerrit"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-02-19 23:13:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'll send out something to the mailing list so we can get more feedback.  Just want to address a few issues here:

> (Zohar) With all that being said, of course breaking any existing drivers was never an intention (if we could get some pointers to which specific drivers were broken, maybe we could even help update them to use the new nvmeof connector?)

The problem with updating the older drivers to the new connector interface is that we'll have to deal with legacy volumes with attachments already recorded in the db (cinder and nova) and that gets pretty messy.

> (Zohar) I would like to propose the following:
> Keep the same old implementation in the connector for when the same old connection info is passed to it. And, only when it sees 'volume_replicas' as a param, then it will use the new logic/features we implemented. Does this sound reasonable?

I'm not sure we want to carry compatibility logic in the driver.  It would be better to have a nvmeof driver that provides a stable API to current consumers, and then extend a nvmeof_plus driver (with a better name) that implements the mdraid and other enhancements that the kioxia driver (and hopefully eventually other drivers) will consume.  Or add a new connector entirely (see next point).

> (Ivan) we agreed roll-back the changes to the original connector to restore API and create a new connector with new API to support MDRAID replication

The rollback will lose the bugfixes, but at this point in the release cycle, it may be best to follow what Ivan suggests and rollback to the old nvmeof connector (warts and all) and add your code back in as a completely new connector that's consumed by your driver.


Hopefully we'll get some helpful input from the mailing list."}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2021-02-20 06:15:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

- DellEMC_Unity_FC_os-brick http://publiclogs.emc.com/41/776441/2/check/DellEMC_Unity_FC_os-brick/69378e0/DellEMC_Unity_FC_os-brick/79 : FAILURE in 2h 00m 32s
- DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI_os-brick http://publiclogs.emc.com/41/776441/2/check/DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI_os-brick/a9324bc/DellEMC_Unity_iSCSI_os-brick/76 : FAILURE in 1h 24m 45s

Leave a comment with 'run-DellEMC Unity CI' to trigger a recheck. For more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Unity_CI"}, {'account_id': 16721, 'date': '2021-02-21 04:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thank you Ivan and Brian for the input! My main current concern is the second item below:


> The problem with updating the older drivers to the new connector interface is that we'll have to deal with legacy volumes with attachments already recorded in the db (cinder and nova) and that gets pretty messy.

Understood, thank you. Then it is better not to take this route to stay on the safe side (to avoid breaking upgrades of existing deployments using this and having to figure out "db update" logic.)


> I'm not sure we want to carry compatibility logic in the driver.  It would be better to have a nvmeof driver that provides a stable API to current consumers, and then extend a nvmeof_plus driver (with a better name) that implements the mdraid and other enhancements that the kioxia driver (and hopefully eventually other drivers) will consume.  Or add a new connector entirely (see next point).

Ok, I am 100% for this, the only drawback being:

If we create a different connector, then we will need to register a new libvirt volume driver 
and volume type / protocol in order to be able to use it.

Essentially, we will need to duplicate the nvme libvirt volume driver (which is basically a wrapper around the connector) and give it a different name:
https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/nova/virt/libvirt/volume/nvme.py

And associate it with a new volume type:
https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L193

Hopefully this is it, but potentially there are other places in nova where the new connector would have to be handled for it to know when to use it.

If this is acceptable by cinder and nova folks, then this is likely the best option.


> The rollback will lose the bugfixes, but at this point in the release cycle, it may be best to follow what Ivan suggests and rollback to the old nvmeof connector (warts and all) and add your code back in as a completely new connector that's consumed by your driver.

That sounds good. The only concern I have is in the previous point about having to make changes to nova.

Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2021-03-10 09:29:25.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-brick/+/777086 is merged, so we don't need this one anymore"}]

commit_message:
Revert "NVMeOF Connector support MDRAID replication"

This reverts commit 9dfa75becbd4056b4a9e11d55c609e0e01c19414.

Reason for revert: This patch changes connect_volume API and breaks existing drivers.
We shouldn't change 'nqn' to 'target_nqn' and require 'volume_uuid'

Change-Id: Ibd749f5bb2b6a13c8f5473f2142d76ca0af61339

(8 comments)

Thank you for working on this driver. I'm still reviewing this change, but i wanted to post some initial comments. Please take a look at them; I don't see any unit tests added with this, could you please add some. We try to maintain a healthy unit test coverage, as you can see in our driver requirements documentation: https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/driver_requirements.html#unit-tests

Also, if you plan to add Documentation in another patch; please ensure you have this word in a separate line in the commit message, before the Change-Id: DocImpact
This ensures that a bug is created automatically when this change merges, to track impending documentation. If you plan on adding documentation alongside this change, adding "DocImpact" isn't necessary.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-01-10 04:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for these changes, and for reporting the bug. I'll +2 once the Zadara CI reports on the latest patchset. The unit test coverage report looks pretty bad: 

 manila/share/drivers/zadara/__init__.py	0	0	0	0	0	100%
 manila/share/drivers/zadara/common.py	       199	44	0	76	20	72%
 manila/share/drivers/zadara/zadara.py	       383	151	0	164	36	53%

The driver requirements doc calls out that you have unit test coverage > 90% [1]. This helps preserve the overall quality of the code base. There's no way we can have a high rate of tempest test coverage. So unit tests are a good bet to prevent bugs that tempest tests can't uncover. I do hope you can add unit tests in a future change and complete the coverage. For your reference, look for the coverage report generated by the "openstack-tox-cover" job from the Zuul CI run. [2] 

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/contributor/driver_requirements.html#unit-tests

Hi Shlomi, Ratnakaram, 

Thanks for your work on this driver, LGTM, and welcome to the manila community!

A couple of things in your tempest configuration:

You have these two options:

 [share]
 ..
 run_share_group_tests = False
 suppress_errors_in_cleanup = True
 share_creation_retry_number = 2 

Any reason not to be running share group tests? Your driver doesn't need to implement "share groups" - this is generically handled by manila - So these tests should just run always. 
Also, setting "suppress_errors_in_cleanup=True" and "share_creation_retry_number = 2" may be masking some genuine provisioning and cleanup failures/bugs - neither option is recommended for production quality backends.

Please see if toggling these options is going to make a difference. 

The last CI run is missing a bulk of the log files. However, the run before that had them, so its probably an aberration. 

Please follow through with regard to the update_access/migration bug - and stay in touch!'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2021-03-09 16:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, thanks for adding the new driver and for fixing the CI issues.'}, {'account_id': 19755, 'date': '2021-03-10 08:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

> Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2
>

>

>

>  [share]

>  suppress_errors_in_cleanup = True
>  share_creation_retry_number = 2 
> 
> Any reason not to be running share group tests? Your driver doesn't need to implement "share groups" - this is generically handled by manila - So these tests should just run always. 
> Also, setting "suppress_errors_in_cleanup=True" and "share_creation_retry_number = 2" may be masking some genuine provisioning and cleanup failures/bugs - neither option is recommended for production quality backends.
> 
> Please see if toggling these options is going to make a difference. 
> 
> The last CI run is missing a bulk of the log files. However, the run before that had them, so its probably an aberration. 
> 
> Please follow through with regard to the update_access/migration bug - and stay in touch!

Goutham, thank you for the kind welcome! and thanks for the prompt support with this patchset. We will test and modify the CI parameters!'}]

It is happening more frequently nowadays: 40 occurrences in 7 days

There is some race happening to delete the created tmp dir

and raise error.

This commit try to create the tmp dir with specific prefix so that

commit_message:
Create tmd dir with specific prefix in check-uuid unit tests

test_fix_argument_yes for check-uuid tool try to
import the created tmp directory and work on that
which is failing with the below error:
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tmpf61iim1k'

- https://88e1de9a81e55d590d5b-26f184bb59af339cfe698349cbda4177.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/770520/8/check/openstack-tox-cover/e3518e8/testr_results.html

It is happening more frequently nowadays: 40 occurrences in 7 days

http://logstash.openstack.org/#/dashboard/file/logstash.json

There is some race happening to delete the created tmp dir
which is then used to import the test file in check-uuid run
and raise error.

This commit try to create the tmp dir with specific prefix so that
any other tests cleanup deleting the *tmp* dir on root path then
it can avoid this failure.

Related-Bug: #1918316
Change-Id: Ibab610d3e59ec22bb8c37d66f262ed1d2648bbf8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 20:26:34.000000000', 'message': 'Handle instance = None in _local_delete_cleanup

Change I4d3193d8401614311010ed0e055fcb3aaeeebaed added some
additional local delete cleanup to prevent leaking of placement
allocations. The change introduced a regression in our "delete while
booting" handling as the _local_delete_cleanup required a valid
instance object to do its work and in two cases, we could have
instance = None from _lookup_instance if we are racing with a create
request and the conductor has deleted the instance record while we
are in the middle of processing the delete request.

This handles those scenarios by doing two things:

  (1) Changing the _local_delete_cleanup and
      _update_queued_for_deletion methods to take an instance UUID
      instead of a full instance object as they really only need the
      UUID to do their work
  (2) Saving a copy of the instance UUID before doing another instance
      lookup which might return None and passing that UUID to the
      _local_delete_cleanup and _update_queued_for_deletion methods

Closes-Bug: #1914777

Change-Id: I03cf285ad83e09d88cdb702a88dfed53c01610f8
(cherry picked from commit 123f6262f63477d3f50dfad09688978e044bd9e0)

commit_message:
Handle instance = None in _local_delete_cleanup

Change I4d3193d8401614311010ed0e055fcb3aaeeebaed added some
additional local delete cleanup to prevent leaking of placement
allocations. The change introduced a regression in our "delete while
booting" handling as the _local_delete_cleanup required a valid
instance object to do its work and in two cases, we could have
instance = None from _lookup_instance if we are racing with a create
request and the conductor has deleted the instance record while we
are in the middle of processing the delete request.

This handles those scenarios by doing two things:

  (1) Changing the _local_delete_cleanup and
      _update_queued_for_deletion methods to take an instance UUID
      instead of a full instance object as they really only need the
      UUID to do their work
  (2) Saving a copy of the instance UUID before doing another instance
      lookup which might return None and passing that UUID to the
      _local_delete_cleanup and _update_queued_for_deletion methods

Closes-Bug: #1914777

Change-Id: I03cf285ad83e09d88cdb702a88dfed53c01610f8
(cherry picked from commit 123f6262f63477d3f50dfad09688978e044bd9e0)
(cherry picked from commit 35112d7667cee9fc33db660ee241164b38468c31)

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for share networks

This commit updates the policies for share networks to understand scope
checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of
changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve
security.

Change-Id: Ie5e87c73e97d4a464ec91db8fba1c5d3e9abfff5

commit_message:
Add regression test for bug 1914777

This adds two tests to cover a regression where racing create and
delete requests could result in a user receiving a 500 error when
attempting to delete an instance:

  Unexpected exception in API method: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object
  has no attribute 'uuid'

Related-Bug: #1914777

NOTE(melwitt): The difference from the cherry picked change is because
I6daea47988181dfa6dde3d9c42004c0ecf6ae87a is not in Ussuri.

Change-Id: I8249c572c6f727ef4ca434843106b9b57c47e585
(cherry picked from commit f7975d640ce1e9fa06d045d35177f07451716f0c)
(cherry picked from commit 4f17ea2f7dedb67802c2a8bc0caa64ff66fd2c9c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 20:26:34.000000000', 'message': "Default user_id when not specified in check_num_instances_quota

The Quotas.check_deltas method needs a user_id keyword arg in order to
scope a quota check to a particular user. However, when we call
check_num_instances_quota we don't pass a project_id or user_id because
at the time of the quota check, we have not yet created an instance
record and thus will not use that to determine the appropriate project
and user.

Instead, we should rely on the RequestContext.project_id and
RequestContext.user_id as defaults in this case, but
check_num_instances_quota only defaults project_id and not user_id.

check_num_instances_quota should also default user_id to the
RequestContext.user_id when user_id is not explicitly passed.

check_num_instances_quota should also check whether any per-user quota
limits are defined for instance-related resources before passing along
the user_id to scope resource counting and limit checking. Counting
resources across a user is costly, so we should avoid it if it's not
needed.

Closes-Bug: #1893284

Change-Id: I3cfb1edc30b0bda4671e0d2cc2a8993055dcc9ff
(cherry picked from commit 4c11d5467a30506a82dd5d32dd22b8958a187c0b)
"}]
commit_message:
Default user_id when not specified in check_num_instances_quota

The Quotas.check_deltas method needs a user_id keyword arg in order to
scope a quota check to a particular user. However, when we call
check_num_instances_quota we don't pass a project_id or user_id because
at the time of the quota check, we have not yet created an instance
record and thus will not use that to determine the appropriate project
and user.

Instead, we should rely on the RequestContext.project_id and
RequestContext.user_id as defaults in this case, but
check_num_instances_quota only defaults project_id and not user_id.

check_num_instances_quota should also default user_id to the
RequestContext.user_id when user_id is not explicitly passed.

check_num_instances_quota should also check whether any per-user quota
limits are defined for instance-related resources before passing along
the user_id to scope resource counting and limit checking. Counting
resources across a user is costly, so we should avoid it if it's not
needed.

Closes-Bug: #1893284

Change-Id: I3cfb1edc30b0bda4671e0d2cc2a8993055dcc9ff
(cherry picked from commit 4c11d5467a30506a82dd5d32dd22b8958a187c0b)

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for share group type specs

This commit updates the policies for share group type specs to understand scope
checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of
changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve
security.

Change-Id: Ie1b72459ae060693badb6fe864454836a4ff1300

subject: [Ussuri and older] Set python_cmd where we need it
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 21:02:21.000000000', 'message': '[Ussuri and older] Set python_cmd where we need it

If you use --start-at-tasks, python_cmd may not be defined when we run
the generate configuration or host container tasks.  We should ensure
this variable is set prior to using it.

This variable was no longer used with the transition of the
container-puppet.py items into ansible itself so it only applies for
Ussuri and older.

Change-Id: I956307d5c69cd4d259fb1ab2731fe0001a196c8e
Closes-Bug: #1907858
(cherry picked from commit 1a085631c09d3617c60ca2f5b18eca9f1385aae5)
'}]
commit_message:
[Ussuri and older] Set python_cmd where we need it

If you use --start-at-tasks, python_cmd may not be defined when we run
the generate configuration or host container tasks.  We should ensure
this variable is set prior to using it.

This variable was no longer used with the transition of the
container-puppet.py items into ansible itself so it only applies for
Ussuri and older.

Change-Id: I956307d5c69cd4d259fb1ab2731fe0001a196c8e
Closes-Bug: #1907858
(cherry picked from commit 1a085631c09d3617c60ca2f5b18eca9f1385aae5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 04:52:57.000000000', 'message': 'Part 1 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- availability zones (GET)
- messages (GET, DELETE)
- quota class sets (GET, PUT)
- quota sets (GET, PUT, DELETE)
- scheduler stats (GET)

Change-Id: I482793d4af6ecb6c9194e7952cb588187fd45d99
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Part 1 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- availability zones (GET)
- messages (GET, DELETE)
- quota class sets (GET, PUT)
- quota sets (GET, PUT, DELETE)
- scheduler stats (GET)

Change-Id: I482793d4af6ecb6c9194e7952cb588187fd45d99
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

This change adds a DOCUMENTATION constant and a get_options method
to the tripleo_dense callback plugin which resolves deprecation
warnings and errors caused by the updated ansible specification.

Change-Id: I7a1872c6fa8fc778e742e9ad417e9bf2560a342a

commit_message:
Correct callback plugins for Ansible 2.10+

This change adds a DOCUMENTATION constant and a get_options method
to the tripleo_dense callback plugin which resolves deprecation
warnings and errors caused by the updated ansible specification.

Change-Id: I7a1872c6fa8fc778e742e9ad417e9bf2560a342a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for scoped tokens and default roles

This patch is the base patch to enable support for Keystone
scoped tokens[1] and default roles[2] in the Octavia API.

It strives to maintain backward compatibility and support for
Octavia Advanced RBAC roles.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/tokens-overview.html#authorization-scopes
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/service-api-protection.html

Change-Id: I4443d4531dc97d14f8277024baa11ab43e87fb39

Previously, if HorzionDebug of Debug was true, horizon::django_debug
was set to True. However, those parameters didn't change the logger
level of horizon components. By this change, when HorizonDebug or
Debug is True, horizon::log_level is set to 'DEBUG'.

Conflicts:
	deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I0a140682c552ba8a4e943124330852259e66142d
(cherry picked from commit 812aa726ef897e624f49edac88171d1645fec072)

commit_message:
Set 'DEBUG' to horizon::log_level if HorizonDebug or Debug is true

Previously, if HorzionDebug of Debug was true, horizon::django_debug
was set to True. However, those parameters didn't change the logger
level of horizon components. By this change, when HorizonDebug or
Debug is True, horizon::log_level is set to 'DEBUG'.

Conflicts:
	deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I0a140682c552ba8a4e943124330852259e66142d
(cherry picked from commit 812aa726ef897e624f49edac88171d1645fec072)
(cherry picked from commit 0502fb1aa09f0f7314d6b71c1358b3eeb063a9bc)

subject: Fix logic to honor HorizonDebug
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-17 13:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-02-19 13:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncheck-rdo'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-03-08 22:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-09 17:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 13:25:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logic to honor HorizonDebug

Debug always has one of true/false and is always set. We should check
whether HorizonDebug is set instead of whether Debug is set.

Also, this change fixes the current logic to make sure that
HorizonDebug: false is honored even when Debug: true is set.

Closes-Bug: #1908362
Change-Id: I514b5a3d4133d3561376ea06a803d019acaa0f0b
(cherry picked from commit f89140402ef211f92309646c2d935d5b9e593f99)
(cherry picked from commit bb7d59c65a1c0feacfa4b05904dfe3f4ca287cdf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logic to honor HorizonDebug

Debug always has one of true/false and is always set. We should check
whether HorizonDebug is set instead of whether Debug is set.

Also, this change fixes the current logic to make sure that
HorizonDebug: false is honored even when Debug: true is set.

Closes-Bug: #1908362
Change-Id: I514b5a3d4133d3561376ea06a803d019acaa0f0b
(cherry picked from commit f89140402ef211f92309646c2d935d5b9e593f99)
(cherry picked from commit bb7d59c65a1c0feacfa4b05904dfe3f4ca287cdf)

standalone mode, since devstack does not support starting another
standalone glance.

to run the remote import test, causing it to stage and import an
image across two different workers. Note we disable it for the
standalone mode, since devstack does not support starting another
standalone glance.

commit_message:
Enable second glance worker for import testing

This enables the g-api-r service in devstack, which allows tempest
to run the remote import test, causing it to stage and import an
image across two different workers. Note we disable it for the
standalone mode, since devstack does not support starting another
standalone glance.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/770487
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/770520
Change-Id: Ica715fc1922f4b36dd0bb008ef6706b86115ec05

commit_message:
Support CLI of Change External VNF Connectivity

Add ``openstack vnflcm op chg-ext-conn`` to python-tackerclient.
This command can execute Change external VNF Connectivity operation.
This API can change VL setting.

Implements: blueprint support-change-external-connectivity
Spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-specs/specs/wallaby/support-change-external-VNF-connectivity-operation.html
Change-Id: I3a935296646361032665082a4060bc21ff51c1b1

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for share group types

This commit updates the policies for
share group types to understand scope
checking and account for a read-only role.
This is part of a broader series of
changes across OpenStack to provide a
consistent RBAC experience and improve
security.

Also fix the HTTP method in the policy
doc for this API.

Change-Id: I8b95e1e70f74052e5bd4af1ba29842420bafd0b2
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: Add image task validation
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-15 16:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-15 16:49:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Presumably we need some way to feature flag this.

Abhi, what is Glance's approach to API versioning? If there will be some flag, we can check it in order to decide whether or not to check the tasks API."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-16 04:32:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Workflow-1
> 
> Presumably we need some way to feature flag this.
> 
> Abhi, what is Glance's approach to API versioning? If there will be some flag, we can check it in order to decide whether or not to check the tasks API.

AFAIK, we bump the image api version [1] after API change or before final release of the cycle. But we did not control the feature based on version, for that purpose we use config option to toggle the feature.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/middleware/version_negotiation.py#L73"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-02-16 16:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-02-17 06:59:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-06 19:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: glance-wallaby'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-06 19:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

The code is landed, the API bump is standalone and has been approved and struggling through the gate but should be in there soon:

commit_message:
Add image task validation

Glance is adding a /image/$image/tasks API to make it easier to
consume the import API. This fetches the tasks after glance-direct
import, and validates that they look like we expect.

Because this is only supported after v2.12, we check for that before
doing the validation. To make that easier, this adds a has_version()
helper to the VersionsClient.

Change-Id: I2850f0659e82bf5c5a1005de0a063e7fcacadb51

- https://review.opendev.org/399472
and when that merges, the following devstack-gate changes should be
applied directly to this new job definition instead:
- https://review.opendev.org/394895

Change-Id: I5d5d31c8d89b0d2812a5e9be18a81611041e6da8
(cherry picked from commit 3be8d40fc56f876f3dea30812e6352e1e482bb86)
"}]
commit_message:
Port the grenade multinode job to Zuul v3

It implements the same behavior of the old one.

It is worth noting that the existing job the MULTI_KEYSTONE does not
produce any effect because this change hasn't been merged yet:
- https://review.opendev.org/399472
and when that merges, the following devstack-gate changes should be
applied directly to this new job definition instead:
- https://review.opendev.org/394895

Both changes are out of scope for this porting.

Change-Id: I5d5d31c8d89b0d2812a5e9be18a81611041e6da8
(cherry picked from commit 3be8d40fc56f876f3dea30812e6352e1e482bb86)

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for share instances

This commit updates the policies for share instances to understand scope
checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of
changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve
security.

Change-Id: I1978fd95f5a9f798dd2d5a2ca011952515319746
